0.title: Fitness startup Cult.fit aims for IPO in 12-18 months
0.article_body: Fitness startup Cult.fit is aiming for an Initial Public Offering (IPO) in 12-18 months, according to senior executives of the company. Founded in 2016 by Mukesh Bansal and Ankit Nagori, Cult.fit has raised close to $685 million to date from investors such as Tata, Accel, Zomato and Temasek. In the last few years, Cult.fit has also made 14 acquisitions.

1.title: 35-year-old gym trainer sitting on a chair dies of heart attack in UP
1.article_body: A 35-year-old gym trainer who was sitting on a chair suddenly shook backwards and died after suffering a heart attack in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. According to his friends, he recently began working on a new real estate business but he used to work out at the gym regularly. Some reports also said he had a mild fever for two days.

2.title: Punjab not taking adequate steps to prevent stubble burning: Centre
2.article_body: The Centre on Wednesday stated that the Punjab government was not taking adequate steps to prevent stubble burning. The Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change noted that incidents of farm fires are increasing rapidly in the state. The use of Pusa bio-decomposer, which turns stubble into manure in 15-20 days, needs to be enhanced in Punjab, the ministry added.

3.title: Have done films with cringe-worthy moments in VFX: Varun Dhawan
3.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan said he has done films that had "cringe-worthy" moments in VFX. "I couldn't say it back then, but now, I feel a little more responsible," he stated. Varun will next feature in 'Bhediya'. "There was a time, even I thought with an arrogance that everything was working. But then, there is always room to improve," he added.

4.title: Denied money for liquor, drunk man kills mother & injures wife in UP
4.article_body: A 28-year-old drunk man allegedly killed his mother and injured his wife in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly during an argument that broke out after his wife refused to give him money for liquor on Tuesday. Police said Suraj was charging towards his wife while holding a knife when his mother tried to intervene. Thereafter, Suraj allegedly stabbed his mother several times.

5.title: Delhi HC rejects plea against symbol allotted to Uddhav's Shiv Sena faction
5.article_body: The Delhi High Court rejected the plea of the Samata Party against the 'flaming torch' symbol allotted by the Election Commission to Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena faction. Stating that the Samata Party had been derecognised in 2004, Justice Sanjeev Narula added that it contested elections recently on a different symbol. The Samata Party also appealed to the Election Commission.

6.title: Cong Presidential polls elections for 'Gandhi family's remote': BJP
6.article_body: BJP leader and Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij on Wednesday said that the Congress Presidential polls were elections for the "remote of the Gandhi family". "They had made Sitaram Kesri the President, then removed him from office. Subhas Chandra Bose was compelled to step down from the post of Congress President. Then he made his own party," he said.

7.title: School principal booked for negligence in 4-yr-old's rape case in Hyd
7.article_body: The principal of a DAV school in Hyderabad's Banjara Hills has been booked for negligence in the rape case of a four-year-old girl. The four-year-old was allegedly sexually assaulted by the principal's driver for two months. The driver had been reportedly entering the classrooms at the school and inappropriately touching female students and misbehaving with them.

8.title: 'Ye humein jail bhejenge, hum inhein school': AAP takes a jibe at PM Modi
8.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday, citing their 'education model'. Kejriwal tweeted a picture of Sisodia sitting with a bunch of kids in a school and a picture of PM Modi sitting with only five students. Sisodia tweeted, "Ye humein jail bhejege, hum inhein school bhejenge."

9.title: Gautam Adani plans Adani Enterprises' first retail bond: Report
9.article_body: Adani Enterprises is planning a maiden ₹1,000 crore ($121 million) bond sale to individual investors, according to a statement from Care Ratings. The bond sale will come on the back of the coal-to-ports conglomerate trying to expand beyond its traditional mainstay businesses of ports and power plants. Care Ratings have assigned the potential issuance an A+ score.

10.title: Newly elected Congress chief Kharge to take charge on Oct 26
10.article_body: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge, who has become the first non-Gandhi Congress chief in 24 years, will formally take charge on October 26. In his first address after being elected, Kharge thanked the party's interim chief Sonia Gandhi on behalf of all Congress workers. He also congratulated his opponent Shashi Tharoor.

11.title: Clear encroachments from public land in B'luru Urban in 3 months: HC to officials
11.article_body: The Karnataka High Court (HC) has directed officials to clear encroachments on the 67-acre public grazing land (gomala) in Anekal Taluk, Bengaluru Urban district, within three months. The court said a report must be submitted after the private parties are removed from the land. Reportedly, 306 houses were constructed on the 67 acres of land.

12.title: Sanjay Malhotra to succeed Tarun Bajaj as Revenue Secretary
12.article_body: The government has named Financial Services Secretary Sanjay Malhotra as successor of Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj, who retires on November 30. Malhotra will assume the post of Officer on Special Duty in the finance ministry's Department of Revenue. Registrar General of India and Census Commissioner in Ministry of Home Affairs, Vivek Joshi, will replace Malhotra as Financial Services Secretary.

13.title: Crackers can be burst from 8 pm-10 pm in Bengaluru: KSPCB
13.article_body: Karnataka State Pollution Control Board (KSPCB) has directed government agencies to ensure that crackers are burst between 8 pm and 10 pm in Bengaluru. KSPCB further permitted sale of green crackers and banned crackers that may contribute to sound and air pollution. All districts have been directed to measure air and sound pollution on seven days before and after Diwali.

14.title: I didn't drive out Tatas from Singur, it was CPM: WB CM Mamata
14.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday said that TMC didn't drive out Tatas from Singur, alleging that CPM was the party behind it. "They acquired land forcibly, I returned it to unwilling owners," she said. "There is no shortage of land. Why take land by force? We have done so many projects," Mamata added.

15.title: 50-year-old man beaten with broom for sporting moustache in Gujarat
15.article_body: A 50-year-old man was allegedly thrashed by two drunk men in Gujarat's Sanand for sporting a moustache. Narrating the incident, the man said, "The...accused came up to me and asked me why I've a moustache before hurling casteist abuses." When he asked why they should have an objection to his moustache, they began beating him with a broom.

16.title: CWC rescues 2 minors kept illegally at Murugha Math in Karnataka
16.article_body: Child Welfare Commission (CWC) has rescued two minors who were kept illegally at Sri Murugha Math in Karnataka's Chitradurga. The minors, including a four-and-a-half-year-old and a 17-year-old, were kept at the Math without any documentation and were rescued after the district's child protection officer notified CWC and filed a police complaint. Police has registered a case against four people.

17.title: Second airport for Chennai is the need of the hour: TN Minister
17.article_body: Tamil Nadu minister Thangam Thenarasu on Wednesday said a second airport for Chennai is the need of the hour. The Parandur airport would not come up at the expense of the villagers, Thenarasu said. "The existing airport at Chennai has the capacity to handle 22 million passengers per year and in 2028, it'll be enhanced to 35 million," he added.

18.title: Chinmayi shares pic of breastfeeding twins, says 'back & shoulders have a different voice'
18.article_body: Singer Chinmayi Sripada took to social media to share a picture of herself breastfeeding her twins at the same time. "Tandem feeding be like...the best thing in the world. Le back and shoulders have a different voice though," she wrote alongside the photo. "The joy and the killer back pain," an Instagram user commented on the photo.

19.title: Tar peels off at newly-built Kundalahalli underpass in B'luru; video surfaces
19.article_body: The tar surface of Bengaluru's newly-built Kundalahalli underpass has peeled off days after a portion of it caved in. A video of it, which was shared on Twitter, has also gone viral, with residents criticising the Bengaluru civic body for low-quality work. "Courts should intervene and punish the contractors and BBMP engineers for this mess," a Twitter user wrote.

20.title: New COVID variants expected with tendency to mutate: Ex-AIIMS chief
20.article_body: Former AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria on Wednesday said new variants of COVID-19 are expected which have the tendency to mutate. However, he said the situation is different now as people are vaccinated and have developed immunity against the virus. "If you are going out, especially in crowded places, [you] must wear a mask," he added.

21.title: Aamir Khan took my role in 'Taare Zameen Par' for himself: Akshaye Khanna
21.article_body: Actor Akshaye Khanna revealed filmmaker Amole Gupte had asked actor Aamir Khan to recommend the script of 'Taare Zameen Par' to Akshaye. "Aamir being Aamir, told him (Amole) 'I cannot recommend a script unless I hear it first...if I'll like it, I'll tell Akshaye'," he added. "I don't think I could've done a better job than Aamir," Akshaye stated.

22.title: Proud of you for making Cong Prez polls a real fight: Tharoor's son
22.article_body: Shashi Tharoor's son Ishaan has said that he is proud of his father for making the Congress Presidential election a "real fight" by throwing his hat in the ring. His tweet came shortly after Mallikarjun Kharge was declared the winner of the election. The total counted votes were 9,385, of which Kharge received 7,897 votes and Tharoor got 1,072 votes.

23.title: We must accept one another for who we are: Madhuri on playing a lesbian
23.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit who played a lesbian in the film 'Maja Ma' said that when she read the script, she felt it was a story that needed to be told. "I felt [it] was...needed to...share the message that it takes all kinds of people to make this world, and we must accept one another for who we are," she said.

24.title: Batten down the hatches: Jeff Bezos on possible recession in US
24.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos on Tuesday said "batten down the hatches" while sharing a video of Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon saying there's a good chance of a recession in the US. "Yep, the probabilities in this economy tell you to batten down the hatches," Bezos tweeted. "I think it's a time to be cautious," Solomon said in the video.

25.title: Neighbour arrested for raping 11-year-old girl in Delhi's Wazirabad
25.article_body: A 28-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping an 11-year-old girl in north Delhi's Wazirabad area on Tuesday. He also threatened the girl with dire consequences if she reported the matter to anyone, but she eventually narrated her ordeal to her mother. According to police, the accused and the girl's family share the same house, which is separated by rooms.

26.title: BJP MP to build ₹25-lakh auditorium in memory of Mulayam Singh in UP
26.article_body: BJP MP Virendra Singh Mast has announced plans to construct an auditorium in Uttar Pradesh in memory of former Chief Minister and Samajwadi Party (SP) founder Mulayam Singh Yadav. The MP has sanctioned ₹25 lakh from his MP Local Area Development Scheme fund for the task. The auditorium will be constructed on the premises of a district court in Ballia.

27.title: PM congratulates new Cong President Kharge, wishes him a 'fruitful tenure'
27.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday congratulated Mallikarjun Kharge for being elected as the Congress party's new President. "My best wishes to Shri Mallikarjun Kharge Ji for his new responsibility as President of INC," PM Modi tweeted. "May he have a fruitful tenure ahead," he added.

28.title: Two cycle-borne people killed as car rams into them in Gurugram
28.article_body: Two cycle-borne men were killed after a sedan allegedly rammed into them on the Golf Course Road in Gurugram on Tuesday evening, police said. One of the deceased's son said that his father's cycle got stuck under the car. He added that the car rammed into another cyclist who was sitting on his cycle near the gate of a society.

29.title: We'll examine West's proposal to cap Russian crude prices: Puri
29.article_body: Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said India will examine West's proposal to cap Russian crude oil prices. "I think there's an exemption for Japan for Sakhalin. Then there's crude which comes through pipeline, so they have exemptions...We'll have to look at it," Puri said. Sourcing crude oil will continue to be a "commercial decision" for oil marketing companies, he added.

30.title: People doubted Sidharth Malhotra, asked 'Can he do comedy?': Thank God director
30.article_body: 'Thank God' director Indra Kumar revealed people questioned his decision to cast actor Sidharth Malhotra in the film. "People would question me earlier, why him (Sidharth), can he do comedy? And I told them he could, 100%," he stated. Indra further called him a "sweet boy". "When you step into a new zone, this is bound to happen," Sidharth stated.

31.title: Apple may release foldable iPad by 2024, iPhone by 2025: Report
31.article_body: Apple will release foldable iPad by 2024, followed by a foldable iPhone in 2025, a CNBC report stated. Ben Wood, CCS Insight's Chief of Research, told CNBC, "Right now it doesn't make sense for Apple to make a foldable iPhone", calling it "super high risk". The report added that Apple could switch to in-house 5G modems for iPhones by 2025.

32.title: Founders should focus on valuable businesses, not valuation: Rishad Premji
32.article_body: Wipro Chairperson Rishad Premji has said that startup founders should focus on building valuable businesses rather than valuation, adding that journey to build sustainable businesses is long and complex. During a conclave, Premji said he feels disappointed when he meets founders for whom money is the most important aspect. "The choices are going to be...myopic and short-sighted," Premji added.

33.title: Tharoor will be ridiculed, shamed for taking on Gandhis: Amit Malviya
33.article_body: After Shashi Tharoor alleged "extremely serious irregularities" in the conduct of Congress' Presidential election process in Uttar Pradesh, BJP's Amit Malviya claimed that Tharoor will be ridiculed and shamed for taking on the Gandhis. "Tharoor is whining like a sore loser. Did he...expect elections in Congress to be free and fair?" Malviya tweeted, adding the worst is yet to come.

34.title: BJP government fond of potholes in Bengaluru: HD Kumaraswamy
34.article_body: JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy on Wednesday blamed the state BJP government for recent road accidents in Bengaluru which were caused by potholes. "The state BJP government is very fond of potholes. As long as there are potholes, money will flow into their pockets," he tweeted. Earlier, Bengaluru was called 'Silicon Valley', now it is called 'Pothole Valley', he said.

35.title: Nestle announces second interim dividend of ₹120 per share
35.article_body: Nestle India declared a second interim dividend of ₹120 per share. Nestle, in its filing, said its board of directors have recommended a second interim dividend on its entire issued, subscribed and paid-up share capital of 9,64,15,716 equity shares of the nominal value of ₹10 each. Nestle had announced its first dividend of ₹25 per share in May.

36.title: Drunk man sets restaurant on fire over incorrect chicken biryani order in New York
36.article_body: A video surfaced online showing a drunk man setting a Bangladeshi restaurant on fire over an incorrect chicken biryani order in New York. "I was very drunk...I bought chicken biryani. They didn't give me it. I was mad...I threw it out," the man identified as 49-year-old Choephel Norbu said. The arson caused over $1,500 in damages to the restaurant.

37.title: Man beats policeman, tears his uniform after hitting 2 bikes with car in Haryana
37.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a man beating a policeman and tearing his uniform after hitting two bikes with car in Haryana's Ambala. The man was reportedly overspeeding when he hit the two bikes and was stopped by police. An FIR has been filed against the man and a probe is underway, police stated.

38.title: Was a dialogue: Urvashi clarifies ‘I Love You’ video not related to Rishabh Pant
38.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela has clarified that her 'I love you' video that went viral recently is not related to cricketer Rishabh Pant. "My...video...was only from acting perspective and was a dialogue scene, not directed towards anyone or from any video call," Urvashi wrote on her Instagram story. Of late, trolls on social media have been accusing Urvashi of stalking Pant.

39.title: FDA seizes 400 kg adulterated ghee worth ₹3 lakh from Mumbai's Masjid Bandar
39.article_body: Maharashtra's Food and Drugs Administration (FDA) officials seized 400 kg adulterated ghee worth ₹3 lakh from a godown in Mumbai's Masjid Bandar area. Three food samples of ghee from the food establishment were taken for analysis. According to FDA officials, ahead of Diwali, FDA's Mumbai division has been vigilant about the food quality used and sold in the market.

40.title: 5 held for forging land documents, cheating land owners in Hyderabad
40.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested five persons who were allegedly preparing fake and forged documents to cheat land owners. The gang identified open land plots on the outskirts of the city and obtained details from the Sub Registrar Office (SRO) about the ownership, police said. Non-judicial stamp papers, fake Aadhaar cards, one car and mobile phones were seized from them.

41.title: Sex ratio of Pune city dropped from 949 to 913 in 2 years: PMC
41.article_body: According to data by Pune Municipal Corporation's health department, the sex ratio of Pune city has dropped from 949 in 2020 to 913 in 2022. A PMC official said the sex ratio had increased during COVID-19 lockdown mainly because many pregnant women had come to their homes in Pune. She further hinted that illegal abortions are taking place in Pune.

42.title: Dwayne Johnson jokes about becoming Britain's next Prime Minister
42.article_body: At the UK premiere of 'Black Adam', Hollywood actor Dwayne Johnson joked about becoming the next British Prime Minister. "Are you ready for another Johnson Prime Minister? Maybe Rock Prime Minister?" Johnson asked in response to a question. Johnson's comment has come days after he stated that the idea of contesting for US Presidential elections is "off the table".

43.title: SaaS startup Drivetrain AI raises $15 mn in Series A funding round
43.article_body: Financial planning startup Drivetrain AI has secured $15 million in Series A funding round from Elevation Capital, Jungle Ventures and Venture Highway. High net-worth Individuals like former Google executive Amit Singhal and Notion Co-founder Akshay Kothari participated in the round along with nearly 25 angel investors. The firm was co-founded by Alok Goel, Tarkeshwar Thakur and Saurav Bhagat.

44.title: Degree student ends life by jumping from 20th floor in Hyderabad
44.article_body: A degree student died by suicide by jumping from the 20th floor of a high-rise building in Hyderabad's Miyapur on Tuesday. She was a student of Nizam College and was staying with her grandparents for the last six months. In a note purportedly written by her, she stated that she wasn't willing to live and was upset with her life.

45.title: Man kills friend after fight over who would be cooking dinner in Hyd
45.article_body: A man, who works as a painter, reportedly killed his roommate after a fight over cooking dinner at their rented apartment in Hyderabad. The injured was rushed to a hospital, where doctors declared him brought dead. The accused, who had accompanied him to the hospital, fled after learning about his friend's death. He was, however, arrested at Nagpur railway station.

46.title: Didn't sleep night before 'SOTY' release, prayed in temple: Varun Dhawan
46.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan, who made his Bollywood debut with 'Student Of The Year (SOTY)', completed 10 years in the film industry on Wednesday. Speaking about the day before the film's release, Varun said, "I didn't sleep that night...I did a little prayer in the temple with my mom." The film was directed by Karan Johar and also featured Alia Bhatt.

47.title: Stray dogs eat corpse of woman near K’taka temple; authorities promise action
47.article_body: Two days after a 68-year-old woman's corpse, partially eaten by stray dogs, was found near Karnataka's Shree Kshetra Ganagapur Dattatreya temple, authorities said they would ensure such a "shameful incident" does not occur again. The woman, who was suspected to be mentally unstable, was abandoned on Saturday and died a few hours later, but her body went unnoticed until Sunday.

48.title: Class 7 question paper in Bihar govt schools terms Kashmir as separate country, pic surfaces
48.article_body: A Class 7 question paper in Bihar government schools termed Kashmir as a separate country. The paper had a question asking, "What are the people of the following countries called?" and listed Kashmir as one of the options. "The matter will be investigated & anyone responsible will be punished," Bihar Rural Development Minister Sharvan Kumar stated.

49.title: Bowler to be wary of isn't Shaheen, it's Haris Rauf: Aakash
49.article_body: Ahead of India's opening game at the T20 World Cup against Pakistan on Sunday, commentator Aakash Chopra has said the bowler to be wary of isn't Shaheen Afridi but Haris Rauf. "Afridi is getting close to his best but isn't there yet...Rauf will bowl the tougher overs and has the potential to make a difference," explained Chopra.

50.title: TRS leaders eyeing lands of Munugode constituency: T'gana BJP chief
50.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar on Tuesday alleged that TRS leaders are eyeing lands in Munugode constituency while campaigning for the by-polls. "In the name of...election campaign, TRS Dandupalyam gang is roaming around Munugode and inquiring about lands," he said. "TRS men are ready to distribute ₹40,000 for a house...That's the money earned by diverting central funds," he added.

51.title: Your political experience will strengthen INC’s ideology: Priyanka to Kharge
51.article_body: Soon after Mallikarjun Kharge won Congress Presidential poll on Wednesday, party leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra congratulated him, saying, "I am sure that your on-ground experience of political life will strengthen the ideology of the Indian National Congress (INC)." She tweeted, "Under your leadership, the Congress will continue to fight for the protection of the Constitution and democracy."

52.title: UltraTech's consolidated profit in Q2 falls 42% YoY to ₹759 crore
52.article_body: UltraTech Cement Limited reported a 42% decrease in its consolidated net profit at ₹759 crore for the quarter ended September 30, 2022, from ₹1,310 crore in the year-ago period. Its revenue from operations increased by 15.61% to ₹13,892.69 crore during the quarter. Sequentially, UltraTech's profit fell by 52% from ₹1,582 crore in the April-June period.

53.title: Powell sends ball out of ground with 104-m six, non-striker's 'shocked' reaction goes viral
53.article_body: West Indies' Rovman Powell smashed a 104-metre maximum, with the ball going out of the stadium during his team's match against Zimbabwe in T20 World Cup 2022. Powell slammed the six on a 137-kmph delivery bowled by Blessing Muzarabani in West Indies' last over. Non-striker batter Akeal Hosein was seen putting hands on his head, seemingly shocked by the hit.

54.title: We fired a senior employee in 10 mins for huge integrity violation: Wipro Chairman
54.article_body: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji, while speaking at an event on leadership lessons, revealed that a person among the top 20 people in his organisation was fired after being found to have committed a "huge integrity violation". "We made that decision in 10 minutes," said Premji. "When the times are tough...you have to make those tough calls," he added.

55.title: 32-yr-old Mumbai woman cheated of ₹2.70 lakh by fraud posing as doctor
55.article_body: A 32-year-old Mumbai resident, Hemali Mehta, was cheated of ₹2.70 lakh by a man who posed as a doctor and claimed to heal her father's legs. "The doctor started working and claimed to have removed 90 clots," police said. The fake doctor quoted ₹4,000 per clot as his fees. He asked Hemali not to mention the treatment to anyone.

56.title: Dutch government to spend up to $3.44 billion in military procurement
56.article_body: The Dutch government will invest up to $3.44 billion in military procurement. In a policy turnaround, the Dutch military will purchase a rocket artillery system and 10 howitzer cannons between 2023 and 2026. "The war on the European continent underlines the need to be able to act in all parts of the spectrum of violence," a Dutch minister said.

57.title: 21-yr-old Man Utd footballer Greenwood granted bail over attempted rape charge
57.article_body: Manchester United's 21-year-old footballer Mason Greenwood has been granted bail four days after being charged with attempted rape, engaging in controlling behaviour and assault. He was remanded in custody on Monday. Greenwood was initially arrested in January after his ex-girlfriend had released pictures of bruises on her body. He has been suspended by United pending investigation.

58.title: Sonia Gandhi meets & congratulates Kharge on becoming new Cong chief
58.article_body: Soon after Mallikarjun Kharge won Congress Presidential poll, outgoing party chief Sonia Gandhi on Wednesday visited his residence to congratulate him. Gandhi was accompanied by Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra. They also met Kharge’s wife Radhabai Kharge. Kharge defeated Shashi Tharoor in the Congress Presidential poll. Meanwhile, Tharoor also congratulated Congress President-elect Kharge.

59.title: CBI arrests BSF medical officer in J&K sub-inspectors recruitment scam
59.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Wednesday arrested a Border Security Force (BSF) medical officer, identified as Dr Karnail Singh, in connection with the question paper leak scam for recruitment of sub-inspectors (SI) to the Jammu and Kashmir Police. Singh is the ninth person arrested since the CBI registered a case in the matter on August 3.

60.title: Delhi Metro ridership rises to 87% of pre-pandemic levels: DMRC
60.article_body: The daily average ridership on the Delhi Metro increased to 87% of pre-pandemic levels in September, according to Delhi Metro Rail Corporation's (DMRC) latest data. In September, 47.3 lakh people travelled using Delhi Metro, compared to 6.19 lakh riders in September 2020, the data showed. In May this year, 39.5 lakh people travelled using Delhi Metro services.

61.title: Etihad appoints Antonoaldo Neves as new CEO after ADQ's takeover
61.article_body: After the Abu Dhabi government transferred Etihad Aviation Group's ownership to wealth fund ADQ, it appointed Antonoaldo Neves as the airline's new chief executive officer. Neves replaced Tony Douglas, who had been Etihad's CEO since 2018. Neves was CEO and a board member of TAP, Portugal's national carrier, from July 2017 to September 2020, according to his LinkedIn profile.

62.title: Fugitive OneCoin founder's associates face court for $4 bn fraud: Report
62.article_body: Three associates of fugitive founder of OneCoin, Ruja Ignatova, or "Cryptoqueen", faced German court on fraud and money laundering charges amounting to $4 billion, as per a report. A Munich-based lawyer connected to Ignatova was accused of transferring $19.7 million on her behalf to buy two London apartments. Enforcement agencies said OneCoin roped in users with fictitious business claims.

63.title: Win of democracy: Pilot on Kharge becoming new Congress chief
63.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Wednesday congratulated Mallikarjun Kharge on winning the party's Presidential poll. "Mallikarjun Kharge won with a huge majority, a win of democracy...I have faith [that] his experience will benefit the party," Pilot said. He added that 9,000 elected people elected the Congress President. "This was never done before by any party," he stated.

64.title: Mobility startup BeepKart raises $9 mn in Series A round
64.article_body: Online marketplace for sale and purchase of two-wheelers, BeepKart has raised $9 million in its Series A funding round led by Vertex Ventures along with participation from existing investors, Stellaris Venture Partners and Chiratae Ventures. The mobility startup was founded in 2020 by Hemir Doshi and Abhishek Saraf. In 2021, BeepKart had raised $3 million in seed funding.

65.title: Submit survey report of waterlogged roads in 2 days: PMC to officials
65.article_body: Pune Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar directed the Road Department officials to submit a survey report on waterlogging on Deccan, Jangali Maharaj and Fergusson College roads within two days. "Administration will check the stormwater drainage system...(and) any blockages," Kumar said. This comes after complaints about flooding of the roads due to works carried out under the Smart City project.

66.title: Bilkis Bano case convicts were out of jail for over 1,000 days each before release
66.article_body: A court document revealed that the 11 men sentenced to life imprisonment for the 2002 gangrape of Bilkis Bano were out of jail for more than 1,000 days each on parole. They were released for "good behaviour" by the Gujarat government on August 15, 2022. The CBI had opposed their release stating that their offence was "heinous, grave and serious".

67.title: Tom Felton shares struggles with substance abuse in 'Beyond The Wand'
67.article_body: 'Harry Potter' actor Tom Felton opened up about his substance abuse and mental health struggles in his memoir 'Beyond The Wand'. He confessed that his drinking habit got so bad that his manager, then-girlfriend as well as his agents had to intervene. "The habit spilled out of the bar and, from time to time, on to set," he added.

68.title: Bankrupt crypto firm Celsius faces US federal investigations: Report
68.article_body: Bankrupt crypto lender Celsius is facing US federal investigations, Bloomberg reported citing filing from lawyers. "Celsius is...subject to enforcement proceedings or investigations in at least 40 states, in addition to investigations...involving the federal government," filings mentioned. Creditors accused Celsius of misleading them about risks involved in entrusting their coins to the company.

69.title: IIT Hyd incubator launches 4-month programme for defence startups
69.article_body: IIT Hyderabad's iTIC Incubator in collaboration with Innovations for Defence Excellence - Defence Innovation Organisation (iDEX DIO) has launched a four-month-long programme to acclimatise defence startups with civilian technologies. In the first cohort of the programme, 10-12 startups will be selected. It was launched by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh at DefExpo 2022 Gandhinagar.

70.title: Rejected offers to play police inspector after 'Shola Aur...': Govvind
70.article_body: Actor Govvind Namdev has revealed he rejected several films with roles of police inspector after he did 'Shola Aur Shabnam' as he feared being typecast. He added people started calling him an egoist for refusing inspector roles at the start of the career. "I was under pressure...I managed to run my household by doing some theatre workshops...other gigs," he stated.

71.title: We owe irredeemable debt to Sonia Gandhi for her leadership: Tharoor
71.article_body: After Mallikarjun Kharge defeated Shashi Tharoor in the Congress President poll and became the party's new chief, Tharoor congratulated him and wished him success. "We owe an irredeemable debt to outgoing President Sonia Gandhi for leadership and for being anchor during most crucial moments," Tharoor said. Kharge became Congress' first non-Gandhi President in over two decades.

72.title: 3-yr-old who reported mother over candy gets chocolates, cycle from MP Minister
72.article_body: A three-year-old kid who reported his mother to the police for stealing his candies received chocolates and a bicycle from MP Home Minister Narottam Mishra. A video of the child complaining against his mother to police sub-inspector Priyanka Nayak surfaced on social media. He drew some lines when we asked him to sign on the complaint, Nayak said.

73.title: HDFC AMC's September quarter net profit surges by 6% to ₹364 crore
73.article_body: HDFC AMC posted a 6% surge in post-tax profit of ₹364 crore for the quarter ended September as against ₹344.4 crore a year ago. Revenue from operations saw a marginal increase of 0.4% at ₹544.7 crore. Its Quarterly Average Assets Under Management stood at ₹4.29 lakh crore as compared to ₹4.38 lakh crore in the year ago period.

74.title: 6 months in jail, ₹200 fine for bursting firecrackers on Diwali: Delhi minister
74.article_body: Bursting of firecrackers on Diwali in Delhi will attract a jail term of six months and a fine of ₹200, Environment Minister Gopal Rai said. Manufacturing, storing and selling firecrackers will attract three years in jail and a fine of up to ₹5,000, he added. The ban on firecrackers was re-imposed on September 7 till January 1, 2023.

75.title: Rupee dips below 83 against the US dollar for the first time
75.article_body: The Indian rupee dip below the 83 mark for the first time against the US dollar on Wednesday. The rupee closed at a record low of 83.01 (provisional) against the US dollar. The Indian rupee is down about 10% against the US dollar this year following the consistent strengthening of the greenback.

76.title: Sooraj Barjatya says he offered 'Main Prem Ki...' to Amitabh Bachchan
76.article_body: Director Sooraj Barjatya shared that he had pitched 'Main Prem Ki Diwani Hoon' (2003) to Amitabh Bachchan. Sharing the narration experience, Barjatya said, "He (Bachchan) listens 'apalak' (without blinking his eyes) and you cannot face the gaze. It's not easy." While Bachchan didn't feature in 'Main Prem Ki Diwani Hoon', it starred Abhishek Bachchan as one of the cast members.

77.title: Asia Cup title is history, we need to get into Super 12s of T20 WC: Dasun
77.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said being the Asia Cup champions is history and their focus now is to enter the Super 12 stage of the ongoing T20 World Cup. "We're a far better team [than] the team we performed in the first game [against Namibia]," he added. SL will face the Netherlands in a must-win match on Thursday.

78.title: B'luru policeman books another policeman for wearing wrong helmet
78.article_body: A traffic police personnel of Bengaluru police booked another policeman for wearing a half helmet, which is prohibited on city roads. The policeman who was fined was driving a gearless scooter with a helmet that didn't fully cover his head. The RT Nagar Police shared the image of the two policemen on their Twitter handle.

79.title: Elon Musk's 'Burnt Hair' perfume sold out within 8 days of its launch
79.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk's 'Burnt Hair' perfume has sold out within eight days of its launch. "28,700 bottles of exquisite Burnt Hair perfume already sold! Only 1,300 left of this unique, limited edition collector's item," Musk had tweeted at 7:12 am on Wednesday. The perfume, priced at $100 (around ₹8,200), was launched on October 12.

80.title: SC grants interim bail to UP MLA Abbas Ansari in Arms Act case
80.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday granted interim bail to Uttar Pradesh MLA Abbas Ansari, son of gangster-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari, in the Arms Act case filed against him. The court has directed the state government not to take coercive steps against Abbas till further orders. Abbas allegedly transferred an arms licence from Uttar Pradesh to Delhi without informing the Lucknow Police.

81.title: PM Modi to unveil 108-ft Kempegowda statue at B'luru airport on Nov 11
81.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will unveil a 108 feet bronze statue of Kempegowda at Bengaluru airport on November 11, said Karnataka Minister Dr CN Ashwathnarayan. The government is reportedly spending ₹85 crore on the Kempegowda statue which is made of bronze. The statue stands on a 23-acre space near the Kempegowda International Airport in Devanahalli.

82.title: Pernod Ricard delaying $244-mn tax demand probe: Indian authorities
82.article_body: The customs authority has asked a Mumbai court to quash Chivas Regal-maker Pernod Ricard's bid to halt proceedings related to a $244 million tax demand. The authority accused the French firm of being a "habitual litigant" and conspiring to "defraud" the government. This development comes amid Pernod Ricard facing business and regulatory stress in India, one of its key markets.

83.title: 'Jai Jai Maharashtra Majha' to be state's official song: Minister
83.article_body: Maharashtra Cultural Affairs Minister Sudhir Mungantiwar on Tuesday said the state government has decided to adopt 'Jai Jai Maharashtra Majha' as the state's official song. "This song has warmth, emotion and spirit and we have decided to adopt it as the state's official song," Mungantiwar said. The state government is reportedly working on adopting two paragraphs of the song.

84.title: 2 men tonsured, garlanded with shoes & paraded in MP on panchayat's order
84.article_body: Two men were allegedly tonsured, garlanded with shoes, and paraded around in Madhya Pradesh's Daboha village on Monday, following an order by the gram panchayat. Police have arrested two accused in connection with the matter. The two men had reportedly hit one of the accused on his head during an argument sometime back, due to which he'd suffered serious injuries.

85.title: No cattle fest at Pushkar fair this year in view of lumpy skin disease
85.article_body: The Pushkar fair in Rajasthan’s Ajmer will be held without cattle fest this year following the spread of lumpy skin disease in Rajasthan. "Apart from this, all other religious and cultural events will be held. Preparations for fair are going in full swing," Sub-Divisional Magistrate, Sukhram Pindel, said. The fair will be held from November 1-7, an official release said.

86.title: Shaheen Afridi injures Afghan batter with yorker, teammate carries him on his back
86.article_body: Pakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi injured Afghanistan's 20-year-old opener Rahmanullah Gurbaz with a yorker. Facing his first delivery of the match, Gurbaz got hit on his toes and was adjudged LBW out. One of Afghanistan's players then carried Gurbaz out of the ground on his back. He was then taken to a nearby hospital for scans.

87.title: Jay Shah's comments can impact Pakistan's visit to India for World Cup 2023: PCB
87.article_body: Reacting to BCCI Secretary Jay Shah's comments that India won't travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023, the Pakistan Cricket Board said, "The overall impact of such statements has the potential to split Asian and international cricketing communities." It added, "It can impact Pakistan's visit to India for the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 and future ICC events in India."

88.title: Tharoor congratulates Congress President-elect Kharge, shares pics with him
88.article_body: After the poll results were declared, Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday shared pictures with Congress President-elect Mallikarjun Kharge. Tweeting the photos, Tharoor wrote, "Called on our new President-elect Mallikarjun Kharge to congratulate him and offer him my full co-operation. Congress has been strengthened by our contest." Notably, Kharge is the first non-Gandhi Congress chief in 24 years.

89.title: Govt releases city-wise list of timings of partial solar eclipse which will occur on Oct 25
89.article_body: The government has released the city-wise list of timings of partial solar eclipse which will occur on October 25. In Delhi, it will begin at 4.29 pm, while in Mumbai, it will begin at 4.49 pm. In Chennai and Bengaluru, it will begin at 5.14 pm and 5.12 pm, respectively. The ending of the eclipse won't be visible from India.

90.title: Mukesh Ambani buys Dubai's most expensive villa for $163 million: Report
90.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani bought a beach-side villa in Dubai's Palm Jumeirah for $163 million last week, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday. The latest purchase by Ambani has become Dubai's most expensive residential real estate deal. It comes months after the Ambanis purchased a beach-side villa in Palm Jumeirah for $80 million, which was Dubai's costliest home at the time.

91.title: Hackers claim to have customer data of Aus' Medibank, call for negotiations
91.article_body: Australia's Medibank Private Limited, on Wednesday, said that an unnamed hacker group claimed to have retrieved customer data from the former's IT systems and had contacted it to negotiate about the same. This development comes six days after Medibank reported an attempted ransomware attack on its network. However, there was no evidence that customer data had been removed, it said.

92.title: Delhi HC to hear pleas challenging 'Agnipath' scheme on Nov 18
92.article_body: Delhi High Court on Wednesday said that it will hear the pleas challenging the Centre's 'Agnipath' scheme on November 18. The Centre has filed a consolidated reply copy in the matters recently, Solicitor General Tushar Mehta informed HC. No prejudice has been caused to any of the candidates who had participated in the earlier recruitment process, the Centre told HC.

93.title: Helpline to complain about taxi, auto drivers refusing shorter rides launched in Mumbai
93.article_body: A helpline number, a WhatsApp chat service and an email for commuters to raise complaints against auto and taxi drivers who refuse short-distance trips have been launched in Mumbai. To lodge a complaint, citizens can call or drop a WhatsApp message at (+91)8454999999, an official said. People can also drop an email to mh01taxicomplaint@gmail.com to register issues.

94.title: Beating of protester at Chinese consulate was unacceptable: UK Minister
94.article_body: British Foreign Secretary James Cleverly has said that the treatment of a pro-democracy Hong Kong protester, who was beaten up after being pulled into the grounds of a Chinese consulate, was unacceptable and the government was considering further action. The altercation happened on Sunday during a demonstration against Chinese President Xi Jinping in Manchester.

95.title: 66-yr-old domestic help falls from window on 2nd floor in Mumbai, dies
95.article_body: A 66-year-old domestic help died after falling from an apartment window on the second floor in Mumbai's Mulund on Monday. Police said Sulochana Lakshman Sostche had stepped on the window's grille for cleaning purposes when both she and the grille dropped down to the ground. "Her body was lying in a pool of blood," a resident of the building said.

96.title: Microsoft acquires 10.89 lakh sq ft of commercial plot in Pune
96.article_body: Microsoft Corporation (India) has acquired 10.89 lakh sq ft of commercial plot at Pimpri Waghere in Pune from Finolex Industries for a consolidated amount of ₹328.84 crore, reports said. Microsoft is reportedly planning to develop a large hyperscale data centre at the location. Microsoft will hold the lease rights for the land for the next 37 years.

97.title: Tamil Nadu Assembly passes bill to ban online gambling games
97.article_body: Tamil Nadu Assembly on Wednesday passed a bill to ban online gambling games and regulate other online games. The bill was introduced by the state's Law Minister S Regupathy. Last year, the government had amended the Tamil Nadu Gaming and Police Laws concerning the ban on online gaming. However, Madras HC struck down the amendment because they found it unconstitutional.

98.title: I think comments about being tired were taken in wrong way: Adam Zampa
98.article_body: Australia's Adam Zampa has said their captain Aaron Finch's recent comment about the team being "tired" was taken in the wrong way. "I think the intensity of the cricket we've played recently has probably dropped...[because] we're keeping in mind how close WC is," clarified Zampa. Australia will play their opening game at the T20 WC on October 22 against NZ.

99.title: Mother Sparsh raises ₹13.50 crore from ITC, plans to raise ₹100 crore
99.article_body: ITC said it has invested ₹13.50 in baby care brand Mother Sparsh, which is in talks with other investors to raise ₹90-100 crore in Series B funding. According to its regulatory filing, ITC's share in Mother Sparsh will go up to 22% with the investment. Mother Sparsh said it intends to enhance its portfolio, especially across baby-care and mother-oriented segment.

100.title: Video shows B'luru airport's Terminal 2 features days before inauguration
100.article_body: Days before the inauguration of Terminal 2 at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport, videos of it have gone viral on social media platforms. An 84-second video showed some features of the terminal, which will be inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi on November 11. "The terminal is nothing short of a masterpiece," said Industries Minister Murugesh Nirani.

101.title: Russian-installed official in Kherson tells residents to evacuate
101.article_body: A Russian-installed official Kirill Stremousov told civilians in the Russian-controlled Ukrainian city of Kherson that they should evacuate as soon as possible as Ukrainian forces could begin counter-offensive. In the last few weeks, Russian forces in Kherson have been driven back by 20-30 km. The commander of Russian forces in Ukraine Sergei Surovikin said the situation in Kherson is "difficult".

102.title: Kharge won against Tharoor with 8 times more votes: Congress MP
102.article_body: Reacting to Mallikarjun Kharge's victory in the Congress Presidential election, party MP Pramod Tiwari said that Kharge won the election with eight times more votes than his competitor Shashi Tharoor. Sharing the vote count, he said, Kharge got 7,897 votes while Shashi Tharoor got about 1,000 votes. Shashi Tharoor congratulated Mallikarjun Kharge for his victory.

103.title: US, S Korean troops stage river-crossing drills as N Korea protests
103.article_body: US and South Korean troops on Wednesday practiced building floating bridges to ferry tanks and other armoured vehicles across rivers as part of a larger joint military exercise. North Korea has condemned the drills for raising tensions and test-fired rockets and artillery in response. The drills are defensive and necessary for deterring Pyongyang, the US and South Korea said.

104.title: Rupee hits new all-time low, slips to 82.77 against US dollar
104.article_body: The Indian rupee touched a fresh all-time low of 82.77 against the US dollar on Wednesday. The rupee slipped 10 paise to end at 82.40 against the dollar on Tuesday. It opened 0.03% higher at 82.33 against the American currency on Wednesday morning. The rupee's previous record low was 82.72, which it hit on October 10.

105.title: 6 am-8 am gang looting homes with doors left open for milk, newspaper in Mumbai
105.article_body: A gang consisting of two women, a boy and a girl have been stealing mobile phones, cash, gold or any other valuable from households that left their doors open for milkmen and newspapers in Mumbai. They mostly operate between 6 am and 8 am. Several thefts were reported in chawls and societies without security guards between Dadar and Byculla recently.

106.title: Ludhiana man poses as police personnel, cheats families of arrested persons
106.article_body: Police arrested a 28-year-old man posing as police personnel in Ludhiana for allegedly cheating family members of people arrested by the police in different criminal cases on the promise of ensuring their release from police custody. His aide is yet to be arrested. They used to target families of the arrested individuals outside various city police stations.

107.title: Umran is real talent, I'm happy that he's not in India's squad: Waqar Younis
107.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Waqar Younis has termed India pacer Umran Malik as a "real talent", stating that he's happy that the 22-year-old is not part of India's squad for the T20 World Cup. "If [you] have pace, everything will go right," added Waqar. Umran made his India debut against Ireland earlier this year and has played three T20Is so far.

108.title: Local trains going towards Mumbai's Churchgate delayed due to technical snag
108.article_body: Local trains on the suburban line of Western Railway coming towards Churchgate are running late by 10-15 minutes due to a technical snag at Borivali station, a railway official said. Meanwhile, many commuters took to social media to complain about the trains being late. "Every day trains running 20 to 30 minutes [late] on western line," a Twitter user wrote.

109.title: Girl killed, boy's arm severed as bike hits barrier at 120 kmph in B'luru
109.article_body: An 18-year-old's sports bike hit a crash barrier on Kempegowda International Airport Road in Bengaluru, killing his female friend and leaving him with a severed arm on his birthday. According to police sources, the boy had borrowed the sports bike from his friend and was riding it at a speed of about 120 km per hour when he lost balance.

110.title: Parents of former Italian PM Renzi acquitted in invoice charge case
110.article_body: An Italian appeals court has acquitted the parents of ex-PM Matteo Renzi who were accused of issuing false invoices for $176,000 in 2015. They were found guilty in 2019. "After years of struggle and pain, my parents were acquitted...I don't wish anyone to live through what my parents had to live through, they didn't deserve so much hate," Renzi tweeted.

111.title: Netflix shares jump 14% as it adds 2.4 million subscribers in Q3
111.article_body: Nasdaq-listed shares of Netflix jumped over 14% in after-hours trading on Tuesday after the company disclosed it gained 2.4 million subscribers globally in the third quarter. Its revenue also increased 6% year-over-year to $7.9 billion in the quarter. The streaming company had lost nearly one million subscribers in the previous quarter and 200,000 subscribers in the first quarter.

112.title: Virgin Orbit to do 1st launch from Europe within 6 weeks: Branson
112.article_body: Billionaire Richard Branson on Tuesday said that his small satellite service provider Virgin Orbit will be doing its "first launch from European soil into space within the next six weeks". The launch will be conducted from UK's Cornwall. Branson further stated, "Virgin Orbit can launch satellites into space from anywhere in the world into any orbit at a [day's] notice."

113.title: BJP releases first list of 62 candidates for Himachal Pradesh polls
113.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Wednesday released the first list of 62 candidates for the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls, fielding CM Jairam Thakur from Seraj constituency. Himachal's Urban Development Minister Suresh Bhardwaj has been fielded from Kasumpti instead of Shimla Urban, where BJP state treasurer Sanjay Sood will contest from. The party has denied tickets to 11 sitting MLAs.

114.title: Ireland record their highest successful run chase in T20 World Cup history
114.article_body: Ireland on Wednesday recorded their highest successful run chase in T20 World Cup history. Ireland chased down a target of 177 in 19 overs against Scotland in their first round match. Ireland's previous highest successful run chase in T20 World Cup had come in the 2014 edition, when they chased down a 164-run target against Zimbabwe.

115.title: Who are the top 5 all-rounders in T20I cricket as Shakib reclaims top spot?
115.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for T20I all-rounders. Bangladesh's Shakib Al Hasan has reclaimed the top spot, while Afghanistan's Mohammad Nabi is ranked second. Nabi is followed by England's Moeen Ali and Namibia's Johannes Jonathan Smit. Sri Lanka's Wanindu Hasaranga is the fifth-ranked all-rounder. Meanwhile, Hardik Pandya is the highest-ranked Indian all-rounder at sixth position.

116.title: Free gift offers can be Chinese websites stealing information, warns govt
116.article_body: The government's CERT-In has warned that fake messages are in circulation on platforms like WhatsApp, Telegram and Instagram that falsely claim a festive offer luring users into gifts and prizes. These messages contain links to phishing websites that mostly have Chinese [.cn] domains. The attackers can entice users into sharing their bank details and other personal information, CERT-In warned.

117.title: I refuse to list my PhD among my qualifications, it's useless: Zoho CEO
117.article_body: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu in a series of tweets said that he refuses to list his PhD among his qualifications because he doesn't value that work and considers it "useless". He said, "Professors were addicted to the models themselves and never entertained any doubts about whether the models had much to do with reality."

118.title: SC refuses to list urgent plea seeking stay on release of Ajay Devgn's Thank God
118.article_body: Supreme Court has refused to list the urgent plea filed by Shri Chitragupta Welfare Trust that sought a stay on Thank God's release. The court listed the petition for November 1, while the film is scheduled to release on October 25. When the Trust's advocate stated that the petition will be "infructuous" by then, the court said, "let it be".

119.title: Drug addict's body with stab wounds found on Mumbai railway tracks
119.article_body: The body of a 25-year-old man with multiple stab wounds was found on the railway tracks near Mumbai's Kurla railway station on Tuesday. Injuries inflicted from sharp weapons were found on the man's neck and chest. The deceased, Nikhil Sawala, was a resident of Ghatkopar. According to the Government Railway Police (GRP), Nikhil was a drug addict.

120.title: 14.5 kg of smack worth ₹15 cr seized from car in MP, 1 arrested
120.article_body: Police arrested a 25-year-old alleged drug trafficker in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch and seized 14.5 kilograms of smack worth about ₹15 crore from a car he was travelling in. The consignment was brought from Assam and was being taken to Rajasthan's Pratapgarh, an official said. Police acted on a tip-off, intercepted the car and found the smack in 15 packets.

121.title: AAP office attacked in Mumbai, party's Mumbai Prez blames Cong, BJP
121.article_body: AAP's Mumbai office was allegedly attacked on Tuesday night, with the party's city President Preeti Sharma claiming that Congress and BJP were behind it, as they have been feeling threatened by its growth. In a press release, AAP alleged that BJP's ranks are filled with anti-social elements, adding that Congress is finished and the corrupt leaders are joining BJP.

122.title: Revival of our party has begun today: Tharoor after losing to Kharge in Cong Prez poll
122.article_body: Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday conceded defeat in Congress Presidential election. Sharing a note on Twitter, he congratulated Mallikarjun Kharge for his victory and said, "I believe the revival of our party has truly begun today." Kharge, who will be the first non-Gandhi to hold the post in over two decades, received 7,897 votes while Tharoor trailed behind with 1,072 votes.

123.title: Australia investigating reports that its pilots trained Chinese military
123.article_body: Australia's Defence Minister Richard Marles has asked defence department to investigate reports that its former pilots were accepting training roles in China. This comes after British government said it was taking steps to stop China from recruiting British military pilots to train Chinese armed forces. Thirty former UK military pilots had gone to China to train its army, BBC reported.

124.title: 10 UP cities including Gorakhpur selected for Smart Cities Mission: UP CM
124.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said that with PM Narendra Modi’s inspiration, UP’s 10 cities have been selected for the Smart Cities Mission. The 10 cities include Gorakhpur. "Everyone needs to become smart with a smart city and promote cleanliness," CM Yogi said. "Many development projects have given a new identity to Gorakhpur," he added.

125.title: UK inflation surges to 10.1% in September, back to 40-year high
125.article_body: British consumer price inflation surged by 10.1% in annual terms in September, which is the biggest jump in food prices since 1980. It matched the 40-year high, it hit in July, data from the Office for National Statistics (ONS) showed on Wednesday. Prices of food and non-alcoholic beverages led the inflation in September as they rose by 14.5%.

126.title: Power cuts in parts of Bengaluru from October 20 to 22
126.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts from October 20 to October 22 as Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) and Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation will be undertaking some maintenance works. Most of these outages might occur between 10 am and 4 pm. BESCOM divisions which will remain affected tomorrow are - Ramanagara, HSR Layout, Kengeri, Jalahalli, Peenya and Bagalakunte.

127.title: SpiceJet hikes salaries for captains to ₹7 lakh per month from November
127.article_body: SpiceJet has announced an increase in the salary for its captains with effect from November. The revised salary will amount to ₹7 lakh per month for 80 hours of flying, the airline said in an official statement. The low-cost carrier said that it has been revising salaries for its pilots on a monthly basis.

128.title: Mallikarjun Kharge becomes Congress' 1st non-Gandhi President in over 20 years
128.article_body: Mallikarjun Kharge became Congress' first non-Gandhi President in over two decades on Wednesday. Kharge defeated Shashi Tharoor in the Congress President poll which was held on Monday. Kharge will replace interim Congress chief Sonia Gandhi, who has been occupying the post ever since Rahul Gandhi stepped down after the 2019 Lok Sabha elections.

129.title: Bilkis Bano case convict accused of molesting woman while out on parole in 2020
129.article_body: One of the 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case, 57-year-old Mitesh Bhatt, was accused of assaulting a woman with the intention of outraging her modesty when he was out on parole in June 2020, as per an affidavit of the Gujarat government. The 11 of them were released from prison on August 15 "on account of good behaviour".

130.title: 2nd phase of 'Mahakal Lok' project begins: MP CM Shivraj Chouhan
130.article_body: MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said work on the second phase of the 'Mahakal Lok' project in MP’s Ujjain city has started. The work includes renovation of ancient temples and heritage structures and restoration of the Chhota Rudra Sagar lake, Chouhan added. After the completion of the second phase works, it will be transformed into “Shri Mahakal Mahalok", he stated.

131.title: Nestle India's Q3 profit rises 8.3% to ₹668 cr, revenue up 18.3%
131.article_body: Nestle India posted an 8.3% rise in net profit at ₹668 crore for the September quarter as against ₹617 crore a year ago. Its revenue surged 18.3% to ₹4,591 crore. It witnessed the highest sales growth during a quarter in the last five years. The Maggi-maker announced a second interim dividend of ₹120 per equity share amounting to ₹1,157 crore.

132.title: Kangana Ranaut to play theatre actor Noti Binodini in her next film
132.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut will be seen playing Bengali theatre superstar Noti Binodini in her upcoming film, which will be directed by Pradeep Sarkar. On Instagram, Kangana shared Binodini's picture and wrote that she "was the first female actress in British-occupied India" who "renounced everything and became a saint" after achieving success. "I'm very happy for this opportunity," Kangana added.

133.title: I'm seeing only Bhuvneshwar: Aakash on bowler Shami can replace in playing XI
133.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has suggested that Mohammad Shami can replace Bhuvneshwar Kumar in India's playing XI in the T20 World Cup. "Shami will definitely bowl better than Bhuvneshwar at the death...Harshal's form [is] fifty-fifty...[and] we have placed a lot of hope on Arshdeep, so maybe that's the only change I'm thinking of at this point in time," he explained.

134.title: Cyber criminals cheat woman over job in airline company in Pune
134.article_body: Cyber criminals cheated a woman over a false promise of a job in a private airline company in Pune, police said. The complainant came in contact with the fraudsters, including a woman, through a web portal in September 2020, Pimpri-Chinchwad Police added. The accused also asked the woman to transfer ₹11,500 into a bank account for the job.

135.title: Mumbai's Jagat Vidya road to be closed for 5 months starting today
135.article_body: The Jagat Vidya road in Mumbai's Kherwadi traffic division will be closed for five months in view of the drainage line work from Guru Nanak Hospital Chowk to the Bombay Bank Building. These arrangements will be in effect for five months from 12 am on October 19, 2022, to 12 am on March 18, 2023, the Mumbai Traffic Police said.

136.title: US to make it harder for Iran to sell drones to Russia with 'aggressive steps'
136.article_body: The US has said that it will continue to take "practical, aggressive" steps including sanctions and export control actions to make it harder for Iran to sell drones and missiles to Russia. "Russia deepening an alliance with Iran is something the entire world...should view as a profound threat," US State Department Principal Deputy Spokesperson Vedant Patel said.

137.title: Shashi Tharoor writes to Congress poll body, alleges 'serious irregularities' in UP
137.article_body: Shashi Tharoor has written to the Congress' Central Election Authority, alleging "extremely serious irregularities" in the conduct of the party's presidential election process in Uttar Pradesh. The letter stated problems like unofficial seals for ballot boxes, the presence of unofficial people in polling booths and voting malpractice. He added that "all votes from UP be deemed invalid."

138.title: Russian commander admits situation is 'tense' for his forces in Ukraine
138.article_body: The new commander of Russian forces in Ukraine said that the situation in the area of the 'Special Military Operation' can be described as "tense". Sergei Surovikin added that the current situation in Kherson is "very difficult" for both civilians and Russian soldiers. He also accused Ukraine of "deliberately striking infrastructure and residential buildings in Kherson".

139.title: Anurag Thakur flags off Mega Cleanliness Drive in Delhi’s Chandni Chowk
139.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday flagged off a Mega Cleanliness Drive in Delhi’s Chandni Chowk under Swachh Bharat 2022, which aims to collect one crore kg of plastic waste across the country. “We have already collected 84 lakh kg of plastic waste in a matter of 18 days and are set to surpass the target,” Thakur said.

140.title: Woman gang-raped, thrown on road in jute bag; rod inserted in private parts in UP
140.article_body: A woman from Delhi was allegedly gang-raped and tortured for two days after being kidnapped by five men in Ghaziabad. Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal tweeted that a rod was inserted in the woman's private parts, adding that the men put her in jute bag and threw her on a road. Four of the accused have been arrested.

141.title: My first protective parental feeling was for Alia, Sidharth & Varun: Karan
141.article_body: Celebrating 10 years of 'Student of the Year', director Karan Johar shared that his "first protective parental feeling" was for Alia Bhatt, Varun Dhawan and Sidharth Malhotra. Karan said the 2012 film gave him three of his "most defining relationships". "Besides my mom, they are the three people I think I talk to every single day," Johar added.

142.title: Was very difficult scene for me: Amitabh on his iconic 'Deewaar' scene
142.article_body: On 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', Amitabh Bachchan shared that the iconic temple scene of 'Deewaar' "was very difficult" for him. He recalled that when Yash Chopra told him the shot was ready, he couldn't move out of his room. Amitabh also praised the writers for the film's script and his character's iconic dialogue - 'Aaj khush toh bahut hoge tum'.

143.title: Promise to dream deeper, work harder: Alia on 10 years in Bollywood
143.article_body: Bollywood actress Alia Bhatt, who completed 10 years in Bollywood on Wednesday, promised her fans to "be better, dream deeper and work harder". The actress, who made her Bollywood debut with 'Student of the Year', said she is "grateful every single day" for being a part of the film industry. "Thank you for the magic," she concluded.

144.title: Wipro Lighting celebrates Diwali the smart way: Wipro
144.article_body: Aiming to spread the message that traditions keep evolving but the festive spirit of Diwali remains the same, Wipro Lighting rolled out their Diwali film, sharing that it intricately captures the emotions of the festival in a #SurprisinglyHuman way. It revealed that the film begins with what feels like a scene from our households, and ends with a smart surprise.

145.title: I have spoken that it could be my last WC, but I don't know: Wade
145.article_body: Australia wicketkeeper-batter Matthew Wade has revealed that he never thought he would be playing another ICC event after the last year's T20 World Cup. "And now, I'm here again and I'm playing," said Wade. "I've spoken that it could be my last tournament, [but] I don't know...I just go in thinking every game is a bonus," he added.

146.title: 5 security guards of Gurugram society arrested for assaulting teen
146.article_body: As many as five security guards of a housing society in Gurugram's Sector 49 have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a 15-year-old boy, officials said. The boy had come to see a Diwali fair organised in the society and was allegedly abused and beaten up with sticks by the guards, police said. The accused are natives of UP and Rajasthan.

147.title: 4-yr-old girl raped by school principal's driver in Hyd; was being assaulted for 2 months
147.article_body: The driver of a kindergarten school's principal in Hyderabad was arrested by police on charges of sexually abusing a four-year-old student in the school. The girl told her mother that the assault had been going on for two months. As per reports, she was allegedly raped by the driver near the principal's chambers on Monday.

148.title: N Korea fires artillery shells to send 'grave warning' to S Korea
148.article_body: North Korea on Tuesday fired artillery shells off its eastern and western coasts, a day after South Korea began annual military drills aimed at boosting its ability to respond to Pyongyang's nuclear threats. North Korea said the shots were designed to send a "grave warning" to Seoul in response to its firing of dozens of artillery shells earlier on Tuesday.

149.title: Piramal Pharma makes trading debut at ₹200 apiece
149.article_body: Piramal Pharma Limited debuted on the National Stock Exchange at ₹200 apiece on Wednesday. The shares were listed at a fully paid face value of ₹10 each. Piramal Pharma recently demerged from Piramal Enterprises Limited (PEL) and the demerger plan received the NCLT's approval on August 12. Piramal Pharma's stock was trading at ₹190.50 apiece at 11:25 am.

150.title: D2C brand ClearDekho raises $5 million in Series A funding round
150.article_body: D2C eyewear brand ClearDekho has secured $5 million in a Series A funding round led by Venture Catalysts and SphitiCap. The funding round also saw participation from Dholakia Ventures, NB Ventures, Estrela Ventures, Cornerstone, among others. In October 2021, the company had raised $4 million in a pre-Series A funding round from OYO Founder Ritesh Agarwal-led Aroa Ventures, among others.

151.title: Green expressway to reduce travel time between Mumbai & B'luru to 5 hrs: Gadkari
151.article_body: The central government is planning a green expressway between Mumbai and Bengaluru that would cut down the travel time to five hours, Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said. Similarly, the green expressway would shorten the travel time between Pune and Bengaluru to 3.5 to 4 hours, he added. Currently, it takes 12-15 hours to travel between Bengaluru and Mumbai.

152.title: Whoever wins, victory will be of Cong: Gehlot on party’s chief poll results
152.article_body: Ahead of the Congress Presidential poll results, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said whoever wins the election, the victory will be of the party. Shashi Tharoor and Mallikarjun Kharge are the two candidates in the party's Presidential poll, held on October 17. "Experience doesn't have any alternative. Mallikarjun Kharge has a long experience. Shashi Tharoor has international experience," Gehlot said.

153.title: B'deshi Mathematics teacher compares Tharoor's hairline to quartic function; pic viral
153.article_body: A Bangladeshi Mathematics teacher compared Shashi Tharoor's hairline to a quartic function. Sharing a picture on Twitter, Tharoor wrote, "Letter received from Jalaj Chaturvedi: 'I believe that Mathematics should be taught beyond numbers. In Mathematical Modelling in grade 12, we explored that your hairline is a good quartic fit. Kindly see below & feel free to use it.'"

154.title: Scotland smash highest total of T20 World Cup 2022 so far
154.article_body: Scotland on Wednesday smashed the highest total of T20 World Cup 2022 so far by registering 176/5 against Ireland in their Round 1 match. They overtook Zimbabwe, who had put up a total of 174/7 against Ireland on Monday. Michael Jones top-scored for Scotland with 86(55), followed by captain Richie Berrington, who scored 37 runs off 27 deliveries.

155.title: Their tummies are visible, they can't move: Misbah-ul-Haq on Pakistan players
155.article_body: Criticising the fitness levels of Pakistan players, former Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq said, "Their tummies are visible, their lower [bodies] are heavy and they can't move." He added, "The reason behind this is there has not been a single fitness test, there is no benchmark." Pakistan will face India in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday.

156.title: Scotland's Michael Jones records highest score of T20 World Cup 2022
156.article_body: Scotland opener Michael Jones on Wednesday recorded the highest score of T20 World Cup 2022 so far. The 24-year-old scored 86 runs off 55 deliveries, including six fours and four sixes, against Ireland. The previous highest score of T20 World Cup 2022 was registered by Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza, who scored 82 runs off 48 deliveries against Ireland on Monday.

157.title: Goldman Sachs announces revamp after Q3 profit falls by 44%
157.article_body: After the Goldman Sachs Group reported a 44% slump in third-quarter profit, the company said it will reorganise its business into three units—asset and wealth management, global banking and markets and platform solutions. The company said its consumer unit will be folded into two separate businesses—wealth management and the newly-created platform solutions unit.

158.title: I didn't like being forced to be all looks: Meghan on 'Deal or No Deal'
158.article_body: In her podcast's latest episode, Meghan Markle recalled her time on 'Deal or No Deal' and remembered how she "didn't like feeling forced to be all looks". Sharing that there was a "very cookie-cutter idea" on how models were supposed to look, Meghan recalled that before the tapings, models would line up for lashes, extensions and padding in the bra.

159.title: Fill up 9,870 advertised primary teachers posts: SC to Haryana govt
159.article_body: Supreme Court directed the Haryana government to fill up the vacancies of primary teachers in the state. The 9,870 advertised posts should be filled up first from the candidates declared successful in the 2014 Haryana Teacher's Eligibility Test results, SC said. If the successful candidates don't join, fill up the remaining vacancies from the list of waitlisted candidates, SC added.

160.title: New Zealand Parliament proposes changes to counter-terrorism laws
160.article_body: New Zealand's Parliament has proposed changes to the Control Orders Act and the Terrorism Suppression Act to put more restrictions on people likely to be planning an attack. The changes include making it more difficult for those categorised to have the designation of "terrorist" removed. The step comes after a knife attack at an Auckland supermarket and Christchurch massacre.

161.title: Abhishek told me once, I agreed to do it: Amitabh on 'Uunchai'
161.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said his son Abhishek Bachchan asked him to be a part of Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai', which also stars Boman Irani and Anupam Kher, among others. "It's an honour for me that Sooraj ji gave me a chance to work in a film like 'Uunchai' with such great actors," he added. The film will release on November 11.

162.title: ISB bags top spot in Financial Times Global MBA 2022 ranking
162.article_body: ISB was ranked #1 in India and #4 in Asia in Financial Times Global MBA 2022 ranking. PGPpro, a weekend EMBA equivalent programme offered by ISB, aims to equip working professionals with the knowledge they need to become global leaders, ISB stated, adding that the programme provides flexibility to learn while working with cohorts in Bangalore, Delhi, Hyderabad & Mumbai.

163.title: With Suryakumar, India's batting strength has increased: Misbah
163.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Misbah Ul Haq has said that Suryakumar Yadav has increased India's batting strength. "Overall, you can see that after last year's World Cup, India have decided to change their approach...they have taken an England-like policy, which is to just go after the bowling," added Misbah. Suryakumar has scored three fifties in his last five T20I innings.

164.title: Attrition at Amazon is costing the firm $8 bn annually, show leaked documents
164.article_body: Leaked internal documents showed that high attrition levels across its global consumer field operations were costing Amazon an estimated $8 billion annually. The documents claim that workers are twice as likely to leave by choice, rather than because they were fired. It showed that in 2021, only a third of new hires stayed with Amazon for more than 90 days.

165.title: Tata CLiQ CEO Vikas Purohit resigns: Reports
165.article_body: Tata CLiQ CEO Vikas Purohit has resigned from the e-commerce company, according to media reports and the announcement was made at a recent board meeting of the company. Purohit is said to have reportedly signed an offer from a multinational company in a non-competing sector to head its India business. Purohit had joined Tata CLiQ in November 2016.

166.title: I don't think Shaheen's return was as good as Shami's: Sanjay Bangar
166.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said Pakistan pacer Shaheen Afridi's performance in their warm-up match against England wasn't as good as Mohammad Shami's impact in India's warm-up match against Australia. "I also feel Shaheen has made a slight change in his technique," added Bangar. Shaheen, who's making a comeback following his injury, conceded seven runs in his two overs.

167.title: Germany fires cybersecurity chief over alleged Russian ties
167.article_body: German Interior Minister Nancy Faeser on Tuesday fired the country's cybersecurity chief after media reports suggested that he had links with people involved with Russian intelligence services. Arne Schönbohm was the head of Federal Cyber Security Authority (BSI) since 2016. The German Interior Ministry said it has launched an investigation into the allegations against Schönbohm.

168.title: Hyd's Hussain Sagar Lake view to be blocked for next 4 months
168.article_body: The Hussain Sagar Lake view in Hyderabad will be blocked for next four months using barricades due to work related to the upcoming Formula E race in the city. These barricades will be removed after completion of the race. Black-topping will be done on the road around Hussain Sagar Lake and various safety tests of tracks will be carried out.

169.title: China blocks India-US move to list Lashkar-e-Taiba leader as global terrorist
169.article_body: China has blocked a proposal by India and the US at the United Nations to list Pakistan-based Lashkar-e-Taiba leader Shahid Mahmood as a global terrorist. This is the fourth time in as many months that China has put a hold on listing proposals to designate Pakistan-based terrorists under the 1267 Al Qaeda Sanctions Committee of the UN Security Council.

170.title: Will buy only if it is given on 'India rate': Pakistan on buying fuel from Russia
170.article_body: Pakistan's Finance Minister Ishaq Dar who is on an official visit to the US has said that the country is ready to buy fuel from Russia if the same rate that India is paying is applicable to Pakistan as well. Dar also said that the West would have no problem with Pakistan importing discounted fuel.

171.title: Snake spotted in business class on US flight
171.article_body: A snake was spotted by a business class passenger on a flight from Florida to New Jersey. The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey said in a statement that the airport's wildlife operations staff and Port Authority Police Department officers removed the garter snake from the United Airlines flight. No one was injured and operations were not affected.

172.title: Russia’s use of Iranian drones shows military bankruptcy: Zelenskyy
172.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Russia's dependence on Iran-made drones to attack Ukrainian targets shows the "Kremlin's military and political bankruptcy". Zelenskyy added that strategically, the move will not help Russia in any way and "further proves to the world that Russia is on the path of defeat and is trying to draw someone else into its accomplices in terror".

173.title: Special cells with attached bathrooms for VIP inmates in Mumbai jail soon
173.article_body: VIP inmates in Mumbai's Arthur Road Jail will soon be granted upgraded living quarters with facilities like adequate ventilation, western-style toilets, attached bathrooms and fans. They will also be given mattresses, bedsheets and served food in melamine crockery, prison authorities said. The newly upgraded living quarters will be handed over to the prison authorities by the end of October.

174.title: Iran to send missiles, drones to Russia including Shahed-136
