174.article_body: Iran will provide Russia with surface-to-surface missiles and more drones, including Shahed-136, Reuters reported. Iran and Russia struck a deal on October 6 when senior Iranian officials visited Moscow. "Russia...asked for more drones and...Iranian ballistic missiles," an Iranian diplomat said. "Where they [weapons] are being used is not the seller's issue. We do not take sides," he added.

175.title: Idea of stardom has changed, now pan-India is new fad: Tamannaah
175.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia shared that in her view, the idea of stardom has changed and the term pan-India has become "a new phenomenon, a new fad". As per the actress, the concept of stardom ended with Amitabh Bachchan and Shah Rukh Khan. Tamannaah was last seen in 'Plan A Plan B' and Madhur Bhandarkar's 'Babli Bouncer'.

176.title: Man opens fire after buying luxury car in Mohali; booked after video goes viral
176.article_body: A builder's son was booked after opening fire in Mohali's Kharar on the purchase of a luxury car. He was booked when a video of him firing a gun in the air, while being surrounded by a cheering crowd, went viral online. The weapon used by the accused was not registered in his name but his friend's, police said.

177.title: India reports 1,946 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 25,968
177.article_body: India reported 1,946 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,542 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 25,968. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,923 following 10 casualties in the last 24 hours.

178.title: SpaceX is losing $20 million/month on Starlink in Ukraine: Musk
178.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to reveal that the firm is losing approximately $20 million per month on Starlink in Ukraine due to "unpaid service and costs related to enhanced security measures for cyberwar defense". "But we will keep doing it," he added. Musk also claimed that the defense department has not given money for the service.

179.title: Govt plans to have helipads along new highways for emergency situations
179.article_body: The government is looking at having helipads along new national highways for immediate evacuation during emergencies. Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said the ministries of Civil Aviation and Road Transport have discussed the proposal. He was addressing the Civil Aviation Minister’s Conference. "All the new highways should have helipads…along them so that infrastructure is in place," he said.

180.title: Massive fire at pathology lab in Noida Sector 63 doused, no casualties
180.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a pathology lab in Noida's Sector 63 on Tuesday and it has been doused, officials said. "No casualty has been reported," Noida Fire Officer Jitender Kumar Singh said. The cause of the fire is not known yet. Earlier this month, a massive fire broke out at a plastic factory in Noida Sector 3.

181.title: Vodafone Idea board to consider fund raise via convertible debentures
181.article_body: The Vodafone Idea board will consider and evaluate a proposal for the issuance of convertible debentures to a vendor on Friday. As of the June quarter, Vodafone Idea's overall debt stood at ₹1.98 lakh crore. A convertible debenture is a long-term debt issued by a company that can be converted into shares of equity stock after a specified period.

182.title: Don't know who to blame: Father of infant mauled by stray dog in Noida
182.article_body: Father of the seven-month-old child, who died on Monday night after being attacked by a stray dog at a residential society in Noida, said that he doesn't know who to blame for this incident. "It was a stray dog which attacked my child and not anyone's pet animal," he added. "My wife lost consciousness upon hearing the news," he said.

183.title: It's just 30%: Kapil Dev on India's chances of reaching semis in T20 WC
183.article_body: Talking about India's chances of reaching the semi-finals of the 2022 T20 World Cup, ex-India captain Kapil Dev said, "For me, it's just 30%." He added, "In T20 cricket, team winning a match can lose the next...And I'm concerned about their making it to the top four." India were knocked out in the group stage of the 2021 World Cup.

184.title: If India & US work together, it will be beneficial for entire humanity: UP CM
184.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said that India and the US working together would be beneficial for the entire humanity. "India is the biggest democracy in the world and the USA is the biggest economy," UP CM said while interacting with a delegation of the US-India Strategic Partnership Forum (USISPF).

185.title: Firm operating crashed helicopter in Kedarnath was fined for lapses in June: Officials
185.article_body: Aryan Aviation, the firm that operated the helicopter that crashed in Kedarnath on Tuesday, was fined by the DGCA in June this year for violating norms, said officials. A civil aviation ministry official said that the firm was fined for violating norms like non-adherence to the maintenance schedule and fake logging. Seven people were killed due to the crash.

186.title: Viral video shows girls dancing at MP temple; minister orders investigation
186.article_body: After a viral video showed girls dancing at the Mahakal temple in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said, "I have instructed the Collector and the SP to investigate the matter." "Messing with religious beliefs in any way would not be tolerated," Mishra added. The priest of Mahakal temple, Mahesh Guru, had demanded action against the girls.

187.title: Centre cleared release of Bilkis Bano case convicts, CBI opposed: Guj govt
187.article_body: Centre had cleared the release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case, while the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and others had opposed their early release and remission in March last year, the Gujarat government told the Supreme Court. The 11 men convicted in the case were released on grounds of "good behaviour", the Gujarat government told SC.

188.title: Never shied away from it: Sidharth Malhotra on two-hero projects
188.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra said he never shied away from two-hero projects and "having other strong characters" in his films. Citing examples of 'Brothers' and 'Ittefaq', which starred Akshay Kumar and Akshaye Khanna, respectively, Sidharth said he never compared his screen time with other actors in the film. "I look at the film in totality," he added.

189.title: Nothing charges or fires Kohli up like playing in Australia: Shastri
189.article_body: Ex-India coach Ravi Shastri has said Virat Kohli will be "very pro" in the 2022 T20 World Cup. "Kohli will be ready to go. [Nothing] charges or fires him up like playing in Australia. He loves playing in front of Australian crowds," stated Shastri. Kohli has scored a century and four fifties in 14 T20Is this year so far.

190.title: Piramal Pharma to list shares at face value of ₹10 each today
190.article_body: Piramal Pharma Limited will list its shares on Wednesday at a fully paid face value of ₹10 each. Piramal Pharma recently demerged from Piramal Enterprises Limited (PEL) and the demerger plan received the NCLT's approval on August 12. PEL's shareholders have been allotted four shares of Piramal Pharma for every one share in PEL in addition to PEL's existing holding.

191.title: BBMP extends deadline of welfare schemes to October 31
191.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has extended the last date to apply for various welfare programmes under the municipal corporation to October 31. Earlier, it extended the deadline from September 19 to October 19. The welfare schemes include ₹5 lakh housing subsidy, free laptops for undergraduate and postgraduate students, smart sticks for blind persons, etc.

192.title: He felt blessed to be able to fly Kedarnath devotees: Family of deceased helicopter pilot
192.article_body: The family of the deceased pilot, who was flying the helicopter that crashed in Kedarnath on Tuesday, said that he was extremely religious, and felt blessed to be able to fly Kedarnath devotees. Late Colonel (Retd) Anil Singh's daughter said, "Only thing...giving me peace right now is...he died doing what he loved and that too in a holy land".

193.title: Flooding in Pune city caused by 'cloud burst-like' rain: PMC
193.article_body: The flooding in Pune city since Monday night has been caused by "cloud burst-like" rain, Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Tuesday said. "IMD had declared yellow alert in the city with rainfall of 60 mm...but actual rainfall was 105 mm in two hours from 10 pm to midnight on Monday," Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said.

194.title: 'Monster' deals with subject that is new for Malayalam cinema: Mohanlal
194.article_body: Actor Mohanlal said his upcoming film 'Monster' "is a special film", which deals with a subject that is new to Malayalam cinema. "I would say that the script is both the antagonist and protagonist, here. Such films happen to an actor very rarely," he said. 'Monster' is Mohanlal and director Vysakh's first collaboration in six years.

195.title: BMC issues COVID guidelines amid surge in cases and new variants
195.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) issued preventive guidelines and precautionary measures against COVID-19 after cases of new sub-variants of Omicron were reported in parts of Maharashtra along with a rise in the number of infections. In its guidelines, BMC asked people to - maintain good ventilation indoors, frequently wash hands and wear masks in crowded places.

196.title: 26-year-old Romina becomes Sweden's Climate Minister
196.article_body: Sweden's new government on Tuesday named a 26-year-old as Climate Minister, the youngest person to lead a ministry in the country. Romina Pourmokhtari was until now the head of the Liberal Party's youth wing. Sweden's new government consists of Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson and 23 ministers.

197.title: Twitter locks staff stock accounts in anticipation of deal closure: Report
197.article_body: Updating its employee FAQ page, Twitter reportedly informed its employees that they won't be able to access or trade shares from the Equity Award Center. As per a report, this was done "in anticipation of the closing of the pending acquisition of Twitter" by Elon Musk. Twitter and Musk have been directed to close the deal on October 28.

198.title: Over 50 lakh 'end-of-life' vehicles deregistered in 10 months in Delhi
198.article_body: Delhi government has deregistered over 50 lakh 'end-of-life' vehicles in the last 10 months, transport department officials said. Over 53 lakh vehicles were deregistered between 2018 and 2022, officials added. A diesel vehicle more than 10 years old, and petrol and CNG vehicles over 15 years old, cannot operate in the NCR region, as per the National Green Tribunal.

199.title: No more excuses to avoid painting: Berger Express Painting
199.article_body: Berger has launched a new campaign titled 'Bahano Ke Side Effects,' urging customers to not make excuses and get their homes painted with Berger Express Painting. It offers interior & exterior painting, wall textures, waterproofing and wood coating services with free consultation and on-site inspection. Getting your home painted is easy with Berger Express Painting, it stated.

200.title: Goalkeepers overlooked for strikers in Ballon d'Or: Real's Courtois
200.article_body: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois said goalkeepers are "overlooked" for strikers when it comes to being awarded the Ballon d'Or. "I couldn't have had a better season...As a keeper, you can't do more...keepers are being underestimated," said Courtois. The Belgian goalkeeper came seventh in Ballon d'Or rankings and also won the 2022 Yashin award for the world's best goalkeeper.

201.title: Britain to abolish visa entry requirement for Guyanese citizens
201.article_body: The British government on Tuesday said the visa entry requirement for Guyanese citizens will be abolished from next month. Guyanese President Irfaan Ali said the government will ensure the system is not abused. British High Commissioner to Guyana Jane Miller said the decision was "a real sign of the confidence the United Kingdom has in the growth of our relationship".

202.title: UK summons Chinese diplomat over attack on protester at consulate
202.article_body: Britain on Tuesday summoned China's Charge d'Affaires over the reports of a protester being assaulted inside the grounds of the Chinese consulate in Manchester. A video of the incident which shows the man being dragged into the consular grounds and assaulted by several men has gone viral. The Chinese foreign ministry has claimed the protesters broke into the consulate.

203.title: Punjab gets India's largest bio-energy plant built over 20 acres of land
203.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday inaugurated India's largest bio-energy plant, built at a cost of ₹230 crore over 20 acres of land, in Punjab's Sangrur. The Bio-CNG project's annual straw consumption will be 1.30 lakh ton. With a capacity of 80,000 cubic metre/day, the project will produce biogas using anaerobic digestion process.

204.title: Chhattisgarh Cong leaders to donate salary for reservation case expenses
204.article_body: Congress MLA Brihaspat Singh said tribal MPs, MLAs and ministers of the party in Chhattisgarh will donate their one month's salary towards legal expenses of the case related to tribal reservations. He claimed Congress has devised a strategy to fight against Chhattisgarh High Court's decision, which reduced the quota for tribal communities in government jobs and educational institutions to 20%.

205.title: We could've scored 180-190: SL skipper Shanaka after win vs UAE in T20 WC
205.article_body: After Sri Lanka's 79-run win over UAE in T20 World Cup 2022, Sri Lanka skipper Dasun Shanaka said he's disappointed with his side scoring 152/8 in 20 overs as they could've scored 180-190. "Tone was set upfront, but Bhanu (Bhanuka Rajapaksa) and I didn't click," he added. Sri Lanka are currently placed third in Group A standings.

206.title: 'Ponniyin Selvan 1' beats 'Brahmāstra' to become 2022's third biggest hit
206.article_body: Mani Ratnam-directorial 'Ponniyin Selvan 1' has emerged as the third biggest hit of 2022 beating Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' and Ranbir Kapoor's 'Brahmāstra Part One: Shiva'. The latest reports claim that the gross collection of 'PS:1' now stands at over ₹450 crore. It has managed to achieve these numbers within three weeks of its release.

207.title: Kohli laughs at Karthik for staring at Arshdeep over stray throw, video viral
207.article_body: A video went viral showing Virat Kohli laughing at Dinesh Karthik after the latter stared at Arshdeep Singh for a stray throw during their T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match. In the video, Karthik can be seen staring at Arshdeep for 7-8 seconds, seemingly unhappy with the throw. Reacting to the video, a fan commented, "Sources say...he's still seeing there."

208.title: UAE's Junaid celebrates hitting biggest six of T20 WC 2022 by flexing muscles, video viral
208.article_body: UAE's number 10 batter Junaid Siddique celebrated smashing the biggest six of T20 World Cup 2022 by flexing his muscles. A video of the same has gone viral. Siddique slammed a 109-metre maximum off Sri Lanka's Dushmantha Chameera to set the record. The previous biggest six of T20 World Cup 2022 was hit by Namibia's Johannes Jonathan Smit (94 metres).

209.title: No time is the time for war: UN Secy Gen Antonio Guterres
209.article_body: UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres has supported Prime Minister Narendra Modi's message to Russian President Vladimir Putin that the present time is "not an era of war". "No time is the time for war. But this time, in particular, is not the time," Guterres said. He also expressed concern over the "large number of civilian victims" in the Russia-Ukraine war.

210.title: When all teams come to Pakistan then what is BCCI's problem: Anwar
210.article_body: After BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said that India won't travel to Pakistan for the 2023 Asia Cup, ex-Pakistan batter Saeed Anwar asked when all international teams come to Pakistan, then what is BCCI's problem. "If BCCI is willing to go to a neutral venue, then PCB should also...[do the same] for the 2023 World Cup in India," Anwar said.

211.title: Ind hockey team hard to beat on home soil: Ex-Aus skipper Knowles
211.article_body: Ex-Australian hockey skipper Mark Knowles said that the Indian men's hockey team is extremely hard to be defeated on home soil and in front of their "passionate" fans. "I believe that any of the top seven or eight teams...could win the World Cup. I think the top, the top two in my eyes are still Belgium and Australia," Knowles said.

212.title: Workers across sectors strike in France, demand higher wages
212.article_body: Workers across sectors in France went on a strike on Tuesday, demanding hikes in salaries to keep up with rising inflation. The strike call, which was originally given by an oil workers' union, was heeded by transportation workers (including rail and bus), school teachers and hospital employees. News agency Reuters reported clashes between protesters and the police in Paris.

213.title: COVID strain with 80% kill rate made in US college lab, say reports; university denies
213.article_body: After multiple reports claimed that a new COVID-19 strain with an 80% 'kill rate' has been created by researchers at a lab at US' Boston University, the college issued a statement denying them. Calling the reports "false and inaccurate", the university said its research didn't "amplify" the Washington state COVID-19 strain, but rather made "the virus replicate less dangerous".

214.title: Delhi logs 141 COVID-19 cases, no deaths in the last 24 hours
214.article_body: Delhi recorded 141 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 2.04% in the last 24 hours, the city health department informed on Tuesday. No new deaths due to the infection were reported in the national capital. The city's active case count stood at 500, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Delhi's total case tally has climbed to 20,05,104.

215.title: Portugal's Diogo Jota will miss the World Cup: Liverpool manager
215.article_body: Portugal's Diogo Jota will miss the World Cup after suffering a serious calf injury, confirmed Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp. "After such a good night at Anfield mine ended in the worst way! In the last minute one of my dreams collapsed," tweeted Jota. Klopp said the forward would not need surgery but is expected to be sidelined for months.

216.title: 1 killed, another person missing as boat capsizes in UP's Meerut
216.article_body: One person was killed and another person is missing after a boat capsized in Ganga river in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut on Tuesday morning, a senior official said. Fifteen people were on the boat when it capsized, District Magistrate Deepak Meena said. The boat collided with a bridge pillar at Hastinapur after losing control in the fast current, police said.

217.title: Man electrocuted to death, several injured during idol immersion in Odisha
217.article_body: A man was electrocuted to death and around 12 other people were injured during an idol immersion ceremony in Odisha's Kendrapara district. The 30-year-old man, Biswajit Lenka, died on the spot when an iron frame he was holding came in contact with a high-voltage live wire, police said. The incident happened during the idol immersion ceremony of Goddess Gajalaxmi.

218.title: Crude bombs explode at Patna University amid 'ego clash' among students
218.article_body: Six students were injured on Tuesday after a fight ensued among residents of four hostels at Bihar's Patna University ahead of student union elections. Students reportedly lobbed crude bombs and pelted stones at each other. Town DSP Ashok Kumar Singh called the altercation an "ego clash". "They...used 'sutli' crackers having loud noise," he added. The victims were admitted to hospital.

219.title: Death toll from IED attack on UN peacekeepers in Mali rises to 4
219.article_body: A UN peacekeeper who was wounded in an IED attack in northern Mali on Monday has succumbed to his injuries, bringing the death toll to four, UN peacekeeping mission MINUSMA said on Tuesday. MINUSMA had initially put the death toll at two. The incident occurred when a vehicle carrying peacekeepers hit an IED during a mine search and detection patrol.

220.title: Not sure if I have ever seen a better white-ball cricketer than Virat Kohli: Ponting
220.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting has stated that he is not sure if he has ever seen a better white-ball cricketer than Virat Kohli. "What he does in ODI cricket is unbelievable. His records are amazing," Ponting added. Ponting also praised Kohli for his captaincy, saying, "He led his team really well. The win in Test series in Australia was amazing."

221.title: 65-yr-old Punjab woman pushed from 1st floor by son over lunch dies
221.article_body: A 26-year-old man allegedly pushed his elderly mother from the first floor of their home in Punjab's Ludhiana over lunch. The 65-year-old woman died on Tuesday while undergoing treatment at a hospital. The accused also allegedly attacked his father, who tried to intervene. The incident took place when the accused asked his mother to cook something else, but she refused.

222.title: My best wishes: Yuvraj to Roger Binny on being named new BCCI President
222.article_body: Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter after Roger Binny was named the new BCCI President and wrote, "My best wishes to Mr Roger Binny...I'm sure the board will benefit greatly from your experience." He added, "Congratulations dada Sourav Ganguly on the completion of your term as President!" RP Singh tweeted, "Congratulations to the World Cup 1983 hero."

223.title: My father took care of everything: Neymar during Barca transfer trial
223.article_body: Brazilian footballer Neymar Jr told a court he did not participate in negotiations over his transfer to Barcelona from Santos in 2013. "My father always took care of it...I sign everything he tells me to sign," he said. The case is based on allegations made by an investment firm that it lost out on its rightful cut from the transfer.

224.title: Haryana CM ML Khattar hosts meet with Indian envoys to 7 countries
224.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday hosted a meeting with the envoys of India to seven countries and apprised them of the progress the state has made in various fields including agriculture. Earlier on Tuesday, the envoys met Chief Secretary Sanjeev Kaushal. "The state government is...formulating new schemes to offer favourable business environment in the state," Khattar said.

225.title: Lafarge fined $777 million, pleads guilty to paying millions to ISIS
225.article_body: French cement maker Lafarge has pleaded guilty to a US charge of providing material support to terrorist organisations. Further, it has agreed to pay $777 million in forfeiture and fines as part of its plea agreement with the US government. US prosecutors said that Lafarge paid Islamic State and al Nusra Front, through intermediaries, the equivalent of approximately $5.92 million.

226.title: Hamas delegation to visit Syrian capital Damascus on Wednesday
226.article_body: Leaders of the Palestinian militant group Hamas will visit the Syrian capital Damascus on Wednesday, a spokesman of the group said on Tuesday. The Hamas leaders would be led by senior Hamas official Khalil al-Hayya, Hazem Qassem informed. In 2012, Hamas vacated its Syria headquarters after publicly declaring support for protests against President Bashar al-Assad's government.

227.title: 'Colourful star got 10 awards despite flops,' says Vivek; fans speculate it's Ranveer
227.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri tweeted that he's "shocked to know how the Bollywood awards mafia works". "This year one colourful star managed to get all 10+ awards despite both of his films being disasters & rejected by audience. This shows how corrupt & 'for sale' is the Awards Mafia," he wrote. Some fans speculated that he was referring to Ranveer Singh.

228.title: Pak threaten to pull out of 2023 WC if India don't travel to Pak for Asia Cup: Reports
228.article_body: Pakistan have reportedly threatened to pull out of 2023 World Cup in India after BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said India won't travel to Pakistan for 2023 Asia Cup. "PCB is...prepared to take hard decisions and play hard ball because it's...aware...ICC and ACC events will...face commercial liabilities and losses if Pakistan don't play India in these...events," a PCB source told PTI.

229.title: Take care of my daughter: Last words of crashed Kedarnath helicopter's pilot to his wife
229.article_body: Pilot Anil Singh, who was killed with six Kedarnath pilgrims on Tuesday after their helicopter crashed in Uttarakhand, last spoke to his wife on Monday. "My daughter is not keeping well. He told me to take care of her," his wife said. The 57-year-old pilot was living in a housing society in Andheri.

230.title: K'taka education portal gets 300 complaints after launch last week
230.article_body: The Karnataka School Education, Literacy and Sakala Minister Portal, which was launched by state minister BC Nagesh last Thursday, has already received around 300 complaints. "Most of the complaints were registered by final year B.Ed candidates who also want to be considered for teacher posts," an official said. Some complaints were on infrastructure-related issues.

231.title: Indian duo of Treesa-Gayatri enters 2nd round at Denmark Open
231.article_body: Indian duo of Treesa Jolly and Gayatri Gopichand entered the second round of women's doubles at Denmark Open on Tuesday. Commonwealth Games 2022 bronze medal-winning shuttlers defeated Alexandra Boje and Amalie Magelund of Denmark 21-15, 21-15 in the first round in 35 minutes. Treesa and Gayatri will now face sixth seeds Jongkolphan Kititharakul and Rawinda Prajongjai.

232.title: If India win against Pakistan, they will win the T20 World Cup 2022: Raina
232.article_body: Former India batter Suresh Raina said if India were to win their T20 World Cup 2022 opening match against Pakistan, then they will "win" the trophy. "The team is doing well right now...if we win the first match, it will set a good tone for us," said Raina. He added Mohammad Shami is "the best option" to replace Jasprit Bumrah.

233.title: US President Biden and Hitler share same mindset: Tulsi Gabbard
233.article_body: Former Congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard has compared US President Joe Biden to German dictator Adolf Hitler, saying they have a "mindset" which justifies authoritarian behaviour. "I'm pretty sure they all believe they're doing what's best," Gabbard said while comparing the two leaders. Gabbard made the remarks while campaigning for the upcoming midterm elections.

234.title: 4 arrested for allegedly desecrating mosque in Jharkhand
234.article_body: Jharkhand Police has arrested four people in Telodih town of Giridih district for allegedly desecrating a mosque. The incident took place on October 4 and the arrests were also made on the same day. The incident came to light after BJP leader Babulal Marandi wrote on social media that the police must investigate the matter "without any prejudice".

235.title: Man of Steel 2 starring Henry Cavill as Superman in the works: Reports
235.article_body: A sequel to the 2013 film 'Man of Steel' is reportedly in the works. As per reports, the makers are currently developing the film with Henry Cavill in mind. The British actor first appeared as Superman in 'Man of Steel' and reprised his role in 'Batman vs Superman: Dawn of Justice' and 'Justice League'.

236.title: Key conspirator in ₹1,257-cr Syndicate Bank fraud case arrested: ED
236.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said a key conspirator in the ₹1,257-crore Syndicate Bank (now called Canara Bank) fraudulent loan case has been arrested. "The accused, identified as Himanshu Verma...a resident of Chandigarh, was arrested on October 15," the ED said. Verma was produced before a court in Jaipur and was sent to police custody for 10 days, it added.

237.title: Officials will be liable for accidents due to poor road works: NHAI
237.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has cautioned its officials and engineers that they will be held liable if a serious road accident occurs due to poor road engineering. The NHAI also noted that in some cases provisional completion certificates were issued for roads which did not have road markings or road signages among other safety requirements.

238.title: Shameful & repulsive: KTR on release of Bilkis Bano case convicts
238.article_body: Telangana minister KTR on Tuesday criticised the Centre for releasing Bilkis Bano's rapists and called it "shameful and repulsive". "Shocking...All along it was reported that the Gujarat government released the 'Sanskari Rapists'," he tweeted. His comment comes after the Gujarat government disclosed that the Centre approved the release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case.

239.title: Ex-Advocate General R Krishnamoorthy passes away aged 92 in TN
239.article_body: Tamil Nadu's former Advocate General R Krishnamoorthy passed away in Chennai on Tuesday at the age of 92. Krishnamoorthy held the post of Advocate General from 1980-1989 and then from 1994-1996. He once served as the Chairman of the Bar Council of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry. He had obtained his law degree from Dr Ambedkar Government Law College in 1954.

240.title: Goa govt to come up with mobile app for state's taxi operators
240.article_body: The Goa government said it will come up with a mobile application to act as a common platform for the state taxi industry. "We will discuss this app with everybody before finalising...The taxi business in Goa cannot stay away from adopting technology," said state Tourism Minister Rohan Khaunte. The taxi issue was raised during the last legislative assembly session.

241.title: 2 children die after falling into canal in Rajasthan's Bikaner
241.article_body: Two children died after falling into the Indira Gandhi canal while playing in Rajasthan's Bikaner district on Tuesday evening. The incident happened under the jurisdiction of the Chhatargarh Police Station area. The bodies of the deceased, Sachin (5) and Vinod (6), were taken out after which a doctor declared them dead, police said.

242.title: Ex-CM's son among 46 Congress candidates announced for Himachal polls
242.article_body: Congress has released its first list of 46 candidates for Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls scheduled for November 12. The party has fielded former state CM Virbhadra Singh's son Vikramaditya Singh from Shimla Rural constituency and Congress Legislative Party leader Mukesh Agnihotri from Haroli constituency. Congress MP and state party chief Pratibha Virbhadra Singh hasn't been included in the list.

243.title: 23-year-old woman in US gives birth just 48 hours after she realised she was pregnant
243.article_body: Peyton Stover from Nebraska, US didn't realise she was pregnant until hours before her delivery, reported KETV. The 23-year-old came to know the news when she visited a doctor to check the reason behind swelling in her legs. The doctor said immediate delivery was necessary as Stover's liver and kidneys weren't working properly. Stover underwent a C-section 48 hours later.

244.title: Infamous too: Raj to troll saying he became famous because of his wife
244.article_body: Shilpa Shetty's husband and businessman Raj Kundra responded to a troll who tweeted, "Who's...going to troll you when no one knows you. You became famous because of your wife." To this, Raj replied, "Infamous bhi." This comes a day after Raj shared a post addressing 'trollers'. He tweeted on Monday, "Trolls, where are you all slowly vanishing...please don't leave me."

245.title: Kerala rabies deaths not due to ineffective vaccines: Central team
245.article_body: A central team that visited Kerala has reportedly told the Union Health Ministry that rabies deaths in the state were not due to ineffective vaccines. Recently, a 12-year-old died of rabies in Kerala despite getting three doses of vaccination. The team reported that many deaths could be attributed to low awareness about the dos and don'ts relating to animal bites.

246.title: Himachal CM to file nomination for state Assembly polls from Seraj
246.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jai Ram Thakur on Wednesday will file his nomination papers from Seraj constituency in Mandi district for state Assembly elections. As per state BJP media centre, the 57-year-old leader will pay homage to ‘Kuldevta’ and ‘Kuldevi’ and take blessings from his mother before submitting the papers. He's also set to address a rally at Kuthah on Wednesday.

247.title: Germany to keep nuclear power plants operational till next April
247.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has ordered that the country's three active nuclear power plants remain operational till April next year. Germany had earlier announced it would completely phase out the use of nuclear power by the end of this year. However, a shortage in the supply of natural gas, following the Russia-Ukraine war, has resulted in a change of plans.

248.title: Russian air strikes target energy facilities in Ukraine
248.article_body: Russian air strikes disrupted electricity and water supply lines in Ukraine on Tuesday. Zhytomyr city, which is 140 km west of Kyiv, was among those hit with almost the whole city without power and water and hospitals operating on backup power. Missile strikes also targeted energy facilities in Kyiv and Dnipro.

249.title: Took just 6 balls to show the world that he was right here: Chopra on Shami
249.article_body: Ex-cricketer Aakash Chopra commented on pacer Mohammad Shami's match-winning final over against Australia in the T20 World Cup warm-up game. "It took just six balls for Shami to show the world that he was right here," Chopra said. He added, "Shami came and bowled yorkers after yorkers. He bowled just one short ball, the rest were all yorkers."

250.title: Assam Rifles seize 92,550 meth tablets worth ₹30.84 cr in Mizoram
250.article_body: The Assam Rifles have seized drugs worth over ₹30.84 crore and arrested one person with the haul from Mizoram's Aizawl. The force said that based on a tip-off, a Mobile Vehicle Check Post (MVCP) was launched by the team in the Falkland Veng area. The team then noticed a suspicious vehicle and upon checking, discovered 92,550 Methamphetamine tablets being carried.

251.title: Apple unveils iPad with A14 chip, iPad Pro with M2 chip
251.article_body: Apple on Tuesday unveiled the next-generation iPad and iPad Pro. While both iPad and iPad Pro run on iPadOS 16, the iPad features an A14 Bionic chip with a 10.9-inch Liquid Retina display, an Ultra Wide 12 MP front camera and a 12MP back camera. The iPad Pro runs on an M2 Bionic chip and features a new Reference Mode.

252.title: Ancient Neanderthals were carnivores, ate bone marrow: Study
252.article_body: Researchers analysed the zinc isotopes from the tooth enamel of the remains of Neanderthals from the Gabasa site in Spain. It was found that the Neanderthals to whom the tooth enamel belonged were presumably carnivores who did not drink their prey's blood. Other chemical tracers revealed that they also ate the bone marrow of their victim without eating the bones.

253.title: President accepts Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam's resignation
253.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu has accepted Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam's resignation with immediate effect after he put down his papers following a row over his presence at a religious conversion event, the Home Ministry said. Delhi government had accepted Gautam's resignation and forwarded it to LG VK Saxena for approval, who had sent it for the President's approval last week.

254.title: Want to see Allu Arjun & Ram Charan in a film, have registered a title: Aravind
254.article_body: Film producer Allu Aravind, father of actor Allu Arjun, has said he wants his son and Ram Charan to do a film together. "I really want to make it happen and I have even registered the title Charan-Arjun and I keep renewing it every year," he added. "I'm sure that this project will happen in the coming days," said Aravind.

255.title: Stars give warnings before they die in supernova explosion: Study
255.article_body: Astronomers have created an "early warning" system that can alert when a massive star is about to die in a supernova explosion. They've found that before the star dies, a dense material suddenly accumulates around it, making it look 100 times fainter. "This means...the day before the star explodes, you likely wouldn't be able to see it," a researcher said.

256.title: 2 labourers die of suffocation while cleaning sewer in Guj's Surat
256.article_body: Two labourers died of suffocation while carrying out maintenance works in the manhole drainage chamber in the Sardar Vallabhbhai National Institute of Technology (SVNIT) campus in Gujarat's Surat on Tuesday. One more person is critical and is being treated at the government hospital. "If we find negligence on part of anyone, we will take strict legal action," police officials said.

257.title: Air India aims 30% domestic, international market share in 5yrs: CEO
257.article_body: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson on Tuesday said the airline aims to have 30% share in both domestic and international markets in the next five years. Wilson said the airline wants to restore its reputation, adding, "We've evidence to indicate that the progress is being made". Air India was taken over by Tata group in January 2022 for ₹18,000 crore.

258.title: Weightlifter Mirabai Chanu lifts actor Aparshakti Khurana, shares pics
258.article_body: Olympic medal-winning weightlifter Mirabai Chanu lifted actor Aparshakti Khurana at an event recently. Sharing pictures, she joked, "Hey @aparshakti_khurana sir let's do a complete CLEAN AND JERK the next time we meet." Reacting to her post, a fan wrote, "She did not put any real efforts into lifting him. That was so easy for her." Another wrote, "So effortless."

259.title: What are Canada's new rules to protect temporary foreign workers?
259.article_body: Canada has introduced new rules to strengthen protections offered to temporary foreign workers, including protecting them from any abuse, mistreatment or discrimination. Employers will be mandated to inform them about their rights in the country and provide them with health care services. Employers cannot charge recruitment fees to employees and will have to give them mandatory training.

260.title: 5 months of preparation was not enough for FIFA U-17 Women's WC: India coach
260.article_body: After India crashed out of the FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup, the team's head coach Thomas Dennerby said that five months of preparation was not enough to get ready for the tournament. "It is always painful to leave...in the group stage...[but] I am still proud of the girls because they were putting in the extra effort," Dennerby said.

261.title: Finance Ministry invites industry suggestions on taxes for 2023-24 Budget
261.article_body: The Finance Ministry has invited suggestions from industry and trade associations regarding direct and indirect taxes for the Union Budget for 2023-24. The ministry said that industry will be required to submit justification for their demands along with the suggestions. The ministry also sought industry suggestions on reducing compliance burdens, providing tax certainty and reducing litigation.

262.title: Indonesia to demolish football stadium where over 130 people died in stampede
262.article_body: Indonesia will demolish and rebuild the football stadium where over 130 people were killed in a stampede earlier this month. Indonesia President Joko Widodo said they will build Kanjuruhan Stadium in Malang according to FIFA standards. A fact-finding team formed by Indonesian government concluded that "excessive" and "indiscriminate" use of teargas by police was the leading cause of death.

263.title: Aryan case probe had irregularities, 7-8 officers behaved suspiciously: NCB inquiry
263.article_body: An NCB inquiry into the Aryan Khan drugs-on-cruise case has pointed out several "irregularities" in the case investigation, multiple reports said on Tuesday. A 3,000-page inquiry report also flagged "suspicious behaviour" of seven or eight officers of the agency who were on the case. An investigation was ordered despite a lack of evidence in the case, the inquiry reportedly found.

264.title: Indian women's junior 10m air pistol, rifle teams win golds at World C'ship
264.article_body: Indian women's junior 10m air pistol and rifle teams won gold medals at ISSF World Shooting Championship in Cairo on Tuesday. Esha Singh, Shikha Narwal and Varsha Singh beat China 16-6 in air pistol gold medal match, while Tilottama Sen, Nancy and Ramita beat China 16-2 in air rifle. India have won nine gold, three silver and eight bronze medals.

265.title: Kotak Investment Advisors looks to raise $1 billion: Report
265.article_body: Kotak Investment Advisors, backed by Uday Kotak, is looking to raise about $1 billion for a new fund for investing in India's residential real estate, according to reports. Abu Dhabi Investment Authority and Allianz SE could reportedly invest $500 million and $220 million in the fund, respectively. Kotak Investment is also in advanced talks with other investors for fundraising.

266.title: Manchester United charged by FA over players' reaction to Ronaldo's disallowed goal
266.article_body: Manchester United have been charged by the Football Association (FA) after their players surrounded referee Craig Pawson during Sunday's Premier League match against Newcastle. The players reacted angrily after Pawson disallowed a goal from Cristiano Ronaldo. United failed to ensure its players conducted themselves in an orderly fashion, the FA said.

267.title: Musk shares meme featuring him, Kanye & Trump with their social media apps
267.article_body: Elon Musk took to Twitter to share a meme featuring him, former US President Donald Trump and rapper Kanye West. The meme named the social media apps Parler and Truth Social, owned by Kanye and Trump, respectively. It also bore the alphabet 'X', a super app that Musk wants Twitter to transform into, once he buys the platform.

268.title: Efforts to end terrorism will continue till last breath: J&K LG
268.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Tuesday said, "Efforts to end terrorism in the whole of J&K will continue till the last breath, I assure." His remarks came after two labourers from UP were killed in a grenade attack by terrorists in Shopian. "Words cannot adequately condemn the barbaric terror attack," he had said on the killings.

269.title: 2 killed, 1 injured in knife attack in German city of Ludwigshafen
269.article_body: At least two people were stabbed to death and one person was severely injured during a knife attack in the western German city of Ludwigshafen on Tuesday, police said. The suspected attacker was shot and injured by the police before his arrest, as per media reports. The motive behind the attack was not immediately clear.

270.title: It'll further energise agri sector: PM as govt hikes MSP for 6 crops
270.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has said the hike in minimum support price (MSP) of several Rabi crops will further energise the agriculture sector. Notably, the government has approved an increase in MSPs for wheat by ₹110 to ₹2,125 per quintal and mustard by ₹400 to ₹5,450 per quintal for the current crop year. MSPs for barley and gram were also increased.

271.title: It glorified Telugu cinema beautifully: Rahman on Rajamouli's 'Baahubali'
271.article_body: AR Rahman, speaking about filmmaker SS Rajamouli, said, "When I saw Magadheera, I knew what this man can do." He added that his "jaw dropped" when he watched Rajamouli's 'Baahubali' for the first time. Rahman further said it "glorified Telugu cinema beautifully". The film featured Prabhas, Rana Daggubati, Anushka Shetty, Tamannaah Bhatia and Sathyaraj, among others, in key roles.

272.title: Germany's cyber security head sacked over alleged Russian ties
272.article_body: Germany's national cyber security agency BSI's chief Arne Schonbohm was sacked from his post on Tuesday over his alleged links with people involved with Russian intelligence services. While confirming Schonbohm's dismissal, Berlin said the allegations had "permanently damaged" public confidence regarding his integrity. His links to a firm with ties to the Kremlin were highlighted by a comedian.

273.title: Please let's not be like her: Urfi on Jaya Bachchan telling media person 'Hope you fall'
273.article_body: Urfi Javed reacted to actress Jaya Bachchan's conversation with media photographers at Lakmé Fashion Week. Jaya is heard telling a photographer who took a tumble, "I hope you...fall." "Please let's not be like her, let's hope all of us only rise...People won't respect you because you're elder to them...or...powerful, they'll respect you if you're nice to them," wrote Urfi.

274.title: Police officer transferred after halting BJP corporator's event in Guj
274.article_body: A police officer was transferred from Manjalpur Police Station on Tuesday, a day after he stopped BJP corporator Kalpesh Patel from conducting a folk singing programme in Gujarat. A video showed Inspector Vijay Desai climbing on the stage at the venue and announcing that police had not given permission for the event. He also requested guests to leave the venue.

275.title: We're like Amar & Prem: 'Laal...' maker denies rumours of fallout with Aamir
275.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' director Advait Chandan has denied rumours of a fallout between him and Aamir Khan. Sharing a picture with Aamir on Instagram, Advait wrote, "For...those talking about...fallout between Aamir sir and me, I...want to say...we're like Genie and Aladin, Baloo and Mowgli, Amar and Prem." Aamir and Salman Khan played Amar and Prem respectively in 'Andaz Apna Apna'.

276.title: Belongings of 2 Arunachal mountaineers found 2 months after they went missing
276.article_body: The belongings of two mountaineers from Arunachal Pradesh, who have been missing since August 17, have been found by an independent search and rescue team on Monday, one of the mountaineer's family said. The team found tent, sleeping equipment, GPS and national and Arunachal Pradesh's flags. The mountaineers had gone missing while climbing Chiumo's peak close to the India-China border.

277.title: I feel ashamed as Indian: Kerala Guv on killings of Kashmiri Pandits
277.article_body: Reacting to the targeted killings of Kashmiri Pandits, Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said he feels ashamed as an Indian. He added, "There can be no greater crime than...the killing of an innocent [person]." Khan further said, "If a single person from my country has to leave his home and become a refugee, no amount of shame will suffice it."

278.title: Police seizes 3,243 kg sacks of cannabis at Assam-Tripura border
278.article_body: Assam Police in Karimganj seized 3,243 kg of cannabis at the Assam-Tripura border check-post on Monday. Police said the contraband was packed in 93 jute bags and was being smuggled to Guwahati in a truck from the neighbouring state. "Another major feat by Assam Police in its drive against drugs...One accused has been apprehended," tweeted Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma.

279.title: 'No space left for talks': Zelenskyy as Russia targets power infra
279.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday said there was "no space left for negotiations" with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin following the latest spate of Russian air strikes targeting Ukrainian energy and critical infrastructure. "Since Oct 10, 30% of Ukraine's power stations have been destroyed, causing massive blackouts across the country," Zelenskyy said in a tweet.

280.title: Puducherry to have medical college offering MBBS course in Tamil: Governor
280.article_body: Lieutenant Governor of Puducherry Tamilisai Soundararajan said that the government is planning to start a medical college offering the MBBS course in Tamil medium. She said she would also consult Chief Minister N Rangasamy to work out the logistics to open such a college. "A committee will be formed to prepare books in Tamil for medical education," she added.

281.title: Karnataka Congress launches 'Say CM' campaign against state govt
281.article_body: The Karnataka Congress launched a new campaign called 'SayCM' to talk about the alleged unfulfilled 2018 poll promises of the state's BJP government. "Answers should be given to the people...Should they pay 40% commission even to talk about their party's manifesto promises?" Congress tweeted. They also put a QR code that takes users to the '40% Sarkara' website.

282.title: 16-yr-old girl tries to sell her blood to buy smartphone in Bengal
282.article_body: A 16-year-old girl allegedly approached a blood bank in West Bengal on Monday to sell her blood so she could buy a smartphone. The blood bank authorities informed Childline India and the girl was counselled before being handed over to her parents. The girl told authorities that she had already ordered a smartphone worth ₹9,000 online.

283.title: Will work on reducing injuries to players, improving pitches: BCCI President Roger Binny
283.article_body: Newly-elected BCCI President Roger Binny said he'd primarily focus on reducing injuries to players and improving pitches in India. Roger said injury to Jasprit Bumrah just before T20 World Cup 2022 affected Team India's "whole plan". He added, "There needs to be more life in...wickets at home, so our teams wouldn't have the problem of adjusting when travelling abroad."

284.title: Jayalalithaa's legs weren't amputated, no slow poisoning: Inquiry Commission
284.article_body: There's no evidence to suggest that former Tamil Nadu CM J Jayalalithaa's legs were amputated while in hospital or that she was administered slow poison, according to Justice Arumughaswamy Commission's report. "This evidence is nothing but a mere surmise," the report said. It also rejected allegations that Jayalalithaa was assaulted on her head with a wooden log.

285.title: Haryana government hikes Dearness Allowance by 4% to 38%
285.article_body: Haryana government has hiked the Dearness Allowance (DA) of its employees drawing salaries as per the 7th Pay Commission by 4% to 38%. The increased DA will be paid with salaries of October 2022 while arrears for the July-September 2022 period will be paid in November 2022. The Centre had also hiked DA of its employees by 4% in September.

286.title: Something to cherish for lifetime: Jaffer on Meiyappan's hat-trick in T20 WC
286.article_body: Reacting to UAE spinner Karthik Meiyappan's hat-trick against Sri Lanka in T20 World Cup 2022, Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter and wrote, "That's a quality hat-trick. Congratulations...Meiyappan, something to cherish for [a] lifetime." UAE skipper CP Rizwan said, "He bowled beautifully...He's a special bowler." The 22-year-old dismissed Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Charith Asalanka and captain Dasun Shanaka.

287.title: Police seize ₹19 lakh from Congress leader in Munugode, 1 arrested
287.article_body: Police on Tuesday arrested one person and seized ₹19 lakh from a vehicle on the outskirts of Telangana's Munugode Assembly constituency during a vehicle check on Wednesday. According to the police, the cash was found in a Maruti Brezza car on its way to the poll-bound Munugode. The car was reportedly owned by Congress politician C Rama Krishna Reddy.

288.title: Indian Defence sector will be a world leader in coming times: Rajnath
288.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday said that Indian Defence sector will be a world leader in the coming times. Speaking at 'Manthan' ceremony in Gujarat, Singh said, "India is the youngest country in the world today, not only from a demographic point of view, but also from the mind." "Its thinking is new, its goals are new," he added.

289.title: ﻿Droom withdraws its initial public offering
289.article_body: A recent notification from the market regulator SEBI shows that automobile e-commerce company ﻿Droom has withdrawn its initial public offering. Droom had filed a draft red herring prospectus with SEBI to raise up to ₹3,000 crore. The proposed IPO included fresh issue of shares aggregating ₹2,000 crore and an offer for sale of shares aggregating ₹1,000 crore by Droom Pte.

290.title: Senior Chinese diplomat attacked Hong Kong protester, says UK MP; China responds
290.article_body: Senior Chinese diplomat Zheng Xiyuan was involved in attacking a Hong Kong pro-democracy protester outside the consulate in Manchester, a British MP alleged. The protester was allegedly pulled by the hair, dragged inside the consulate and beaten by the staff. China has responded to the allegations, saying the protesters 'illegally entered' the consulate and 'violated its peace and dignity'.

291.title: Stain on Modi govt's legacy: Cong on release of Bilkis case convicts
291.article_body: Congress on Tuesday accused the PM Narendra Modi-led central government of granting release to convicts in the Bilkis Bano case for political motives, adding that the stain on the government's legacy won't wash off. "It is repugnant, reprehensible and revolting that an elected government chose to release these convicts in such a cavalier manner," said Congress spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi.

292.title: Over 30,000 near-Earth asteroids have been discovered so far: ESA
292.article_body: According to the European Space Agency (ESA), over 30,000 near-Earth Asteroids (NEAs) have been discovered so far. NEAs are rocky bodies orbiting the Sun on a path that brings them close to Earth's orbit. They comprise one-third of around one million asteroids discovered in the solar system. Most of these NEAs live in the asteroid belt between Jupiter and Mars.

293.title: Govt should set moderate divestment targets: DIPAM Secretary
293.article_body: Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey said that the government should focus on privatisation of state-run companies instead of chasing high divestment targets. "We should actually have moderate targets and more focus should be on privatising," he said. Indian government has set a ₹650 billion divestment and privatisation target for 2022-23.

294.title: Adani Defence & Aerospace to acquire Air Works for ₹400 crore
294.article_body: Adani Group's wholly-owned subsidiary, Adani Defence & Aerospace, said it has signed definitive agreements to acquire Air Works for ₹400 crore. According to the statement, Air Works is India's oldest maintenance, repair and operations (MRO) organisation with six maintenance bays and over 900 maintenance experts. Indian MRO market is expected to grow three times by 2030, the company highlighted.

295.title: Pic of valid insurance policy of Ranveer Singh's ₹3.9 crore Aston Martin surfaces online
295.article_body: After a Twitter user claimed that Ranveer Singh was driving his ₹3.9 crore Aston Martin with expired insurance, it has now emerged that the car does have a valid insurance policy and the document has been shared online. The document shows the insurance was renewed as recently as this July. He was recently seen driving the vehicle at Mumbai airport.

296.title: Cyclone Sitrang likely to develop over Bay of Bengal around Oct 24
296.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday said the post-monsoon season's first cyclone is likely to develop over the Bay of Bengal around October 24. A low-pressure area is likely to develop by Thursday over southeast and adjoining east-central Bay of Bengal, the IMD added. Once it intensifies into a cyclone, it will be called 'Sitrang', as named by Thailand.

297.title: BJP wins all three seats in Zila Panchayat bypolls in Goa
297.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has won all three seats in the bypolls to Zila Panchayat constituencies in Goa, results of which were declared on Tuesday. BJP candidates Paresh Naik and Sandeep Kashinath Bandodkar won from Davorlim and Reis-Magos constituencies respectively while BJP-backed independent candidate Merciana Mendes E Vaz won from Cortalim constituency. Bandodkar won by 4,244 votes.

298.title: Mohanlal's 'Monster' banned in Gulf countries over LGBTQ content: Reports
298.article_body: Actor Mohanlal's upcoming Malayalam movie 'Monster' has reportedly been banned in the Gulf countries. As per reports, it was not cleared in the Gulf region as the censor board was not happy with the LGBTQ content in it. The makers have reportedly decided to re-submit the movie to the censor board after making necessary changes.

299.title: New Zealand's inflation stays near 32-year high at 7.2% in Q3
299.article_body: New Zealand's inflation remained near a 32-year high in the third quarter as annual inflation eased to 7.2% from 7.3% in the second quarter, Statistics New Zealand said on Tuesday. Consumer prices rose 2.2% in the last quarter. Earlier, New Zealand's Reserve Bank had predicted inflation would drop to 6.4%, while economists expected the rate to drop to 6.5%.

300.title: John Cena shares old pic of New Zealand batter Glenn Phillips on Instagram
300.article_body: Actor and WWE wrestler John Cena took to Instagram to share an old picture of New Zealand batter Glenn Phillips celebrating his T20I hundred against West Indies in 2020. His post comes amid T20 World Cup 2022 being held in Australia. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "So...John Cena is the third umpire?" Another wrote, "Do you watch cricket?"

301.title: Education isn't business: Varun Gandhi on UP student crying over fees
301.article_body: BJP's Varun Gandhi on Tuesday shared a video of a girl who reportedly studies at a private school in UP's Unnao, crying as she was disallowed from taking an exam over non-payment of fees. "Private institutions, don't forget humanity. Education is not a business," Gandhi said, adding that the tears of the girl show the pain of lakhs of children.

302.title: Indians can see who allowed rapists to walk free: Moitra on Bilkis case
302.article_body: Reacting to the release of Bilkis Bano's rape convicts, TMC MP Mahua Moitra said, "Indians can see for the first time...who allowed rapists and killers to walk free prematurely." This comes after the Gujarat government disclosed that the central government had approved the release of the convicts. Moitra tweeted, "The CBI said NO...And yet Centre said YES to...'premature release' of...convicts."

303.title: Deeply saddened: Sunny Deol on Kedarnath helicopter crash
303.article_body: After a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims crashed in Uttarakhand, Sunny Deol tweeted, "Deeply saddened to hear about the Kedarnath helicopter tragedy. My heart goes out to the families of the pilgrims and the pilot. Om Shanti." Meanwhile, Sanjay Dutt wrote, "Sending my deepest condolences to the families of the people who lost their lives in the helicopter crash today."

304.title: Quoted judgments, facts missing: SC on Guj govt's reply in Bilkis Bano rape convicts' release
304.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday said Gujarat government's reply to pleas challenging release of 11 convicts in Bilkis Bano rape case has quoted a series of judgments but factual statements are missing. "A very bulky counter. Where is the factual statement, where is the application of mind?" the SC said. Pleas challenging convicts' release will next be heard on November 29.

305.title: IFS officer shares pic of a rare clouded leopard, says 'See the amazing patterns'
305.article_body: Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Parveen Kaswan recently took to Twitter to share a picture of a clouded leopard, which he said was "one of the rare big cat species found in India". "Clouded leopards are beautiful creatures. See the amazing patterns," he tweeted. He also said that the species is very less studied and understood.

306.title: WI have what it takes to turn it around: Holder ahead of Zimbabwe game
306.article_body: Ahead of West Indies' Group B match against Zimbabwe in T20 World Cup 2022, West Indies all-rounder Jason Holder said his side has what it takes to turn it around following their "disappointing" performance against Scotland. "We obviously didn't bat well yesterday," he added. West Indies lost the match by 42 runs. They will face Zimbabwe on Wednesday.

307.title: About ₹95,000 cr to be invested in aviation sector in 4 yrs: Scindia
307.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has said the government and the private sector will make investments worth about ₹95,000 crore in India's civil aviation sector in next four years. The investments will reportedly be on development of greenfield and brownfield airports. This sector has passed through difficult times and it's now ready for take-off to its true potential, he added.

308.title: Amit Shah should resign: Siddaramaiah on release of Bilkis Bano case convicts
308.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah demanded the resignation of Union Home Minister Amit Shah, saying his office ordered the release of convicts in the Bilkis Bano case. "The release of those inhuman rapists and murderers is to polarise electorate ahead of Gujarat elections," Siddaramaiah tweeted. "For BJP, elections become more important than the concerns of women of this country," he added.

309.title: J&K LG condemns killing of 2 UP labourers in grenade attack
309.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Tuesday denounced the killing of two labourers from Uttar Pradesh in a grenade attack by terrorists in Shopian. "Words cannot adequately condemn the barbaric terror attack on Manish Kumar and Ram Sagar from Kannauj, Uttar Pradesh," LG's office said in a statement. "We've intensified...efforts to crush terrorists and terror ecosystem," it stated.

310.title: Ethiopian army captures 3 towns from rebel forces in Tigray region
310.article_body: Ethiopia's national army has seized control of three towns from regional forces in the rebel-held Tigray province, the federal government said on Tuesday. "The (army) has taken control of...Shire, Alamata, and Korem....," the government stated. The Tigray conflict is a result of rivalries between regional power blocs and disagreement over power sharing between federal and regional authorities.

311.title: Pakistani drone shot by BSF at Punjab border; 3rd incident in 4 days
311.article_body: A Pakistani drone, found to be ferrying 2.5 kgs of narcotics, was shot down by the Border Security Force (BSF) along the International Border in Punjab's Amritsar, an official said on Tuesday. "A bullet hit the drone, due to which it fell to the ground," a BSF spokesperson said. This is the third such incident in the past four days.

312.title: Extremely sad: UP CM condoles loss of lives in Kedarnath helicopter crash
312.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath condoled the loss of lives in a helicopter crash near Uttarakhand's Kedarnath Dham on Tuesday, calling the incident "extremely sad". "May Prabhu Shri Ram grant a place to the departed souls at his feet. My condolences are with the bereaved families," he said. Seven people, including the pilot, were killed in the accident, officials said.

313.title: Nothing has materialised on acquisition of dr Gerard as yet: Parle
313.article_body: Biscuit maker Parle Products' Senior Category Head B Krishna Rao on Tuesday said though there was discussion some time back regarding acquisition of Polish biscuit and cookies firm dr Gerard, "nothing has materialised as yet". Reports had earlier claimed that Parle is in talks with private equity firm Bridgepoint for dr Gerard's acquisition. Bridgepoint had bought dr Gerard in 2013.

314.title: 1 child/minute being admitted for malnutrition treatment in Somalia: UNICEF
314.article_body: One child is being admitted to a health facility for the treatment of "severe acute malnutrition" every minute in Somalia, a UNICEF spokesperson said on Tuesday. This comes as Somalia faces a drought that threatens to cause the deaths of children on a scale that the UNICEF official said has not been witnessed "in half a century".

315.title: PM should undergo lie detector test & say CBI, ED independent: AAP
315.article_body: BJP should ask PM Narendra Modi to undergo a lie detector test and say the CBI and the ED are independent and have nothing to do with the party, AAP said on Tuesday. The comments came after BJP's Kapil Mishra asked Manish Sisodia to take a lie detector test over his claim that the CBI asked him to quit AAP.

316.title: Delhi Police seize over 2,000 kg firecrackers; 6 arrested
316.article_body: Delhi Police arrested six people in four separate operations and seized over 2,000 kg of firecrackers. The accused were identified as Kapil (27), Shanky (33), Suresh (59), Rakesh (40), Sagar (27) and Sanjay (53). Notably, three operations were carried out by police teams of Dwarka, North East and South Delhi districts, and one other was conducted by the narcotics squad.

317.title: Mumbai-based hotelier's family gets daughter-in-law booked for theft
317.article_body: A Mumbai-based hotelier's family has accused their daughter-in-law of stealing jewellery worth ₹18 lakh from her marital home. The mother-in-law of the woman approached the Bandra Metropolitan Magistrate court after which a case was registered. Incidentally, the accused had filed a complaint with the Khar Police in 2021 in which she had accused her husband of sexual abuse and harassment.

318.title: Haryana govt to open 40 urban health centres in Gurugram
318.article_body: The Haryana government will soon open 40 urban health centres in Gurugram city, said Gurugram Deputy Commissioner Nishant Kumar Yadav. The new wellness centres will ease the burden on the existing medical facilities, he said. "Each centre will have facilities to carry out 14 types of tests and offer 12 types of medical services to patients," he said.

319.title: Unsure if potholes resulted in B'luru woman being run over: BBMP
319.article_body: The BBMP reportedly said it has not yet been determined whether potholes led to the death of the Bengaluru woman who fell from her scooter and was mowed down by a bus. "It won't be possible to determine...the cause...until reports from the...police teams are in," said Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath. The traffic police said they'll file a report soon.

320.title: 5 teens drown in river during picnic in MP; CM announces ex-gratia
320.article_body: Five boys, aged between 13 and 15, drowned in a river during a picnic on Monday in Madhya Pradesh's Katni district, police said on Tuesday. "[My] heart is filled with immense pain due to the untimely demise of innocent children," CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan tweeted. Katni Collector said the deceased's families will each receive an ex-gratia payment of ₹4 lakh.

321.title: Delhi recorded 314 new dengue cases in the past week
321.article_body: Delhi registered 314 dengue cases in the past week, which is seven cases fewer than last week's tally. In the week before, 321 dengue cases were reported. According to the Municipal Corporation Department, 635 dengue cases were reported this month till October 12. In total, 1,572 cases have been reported this year in the city so far.

322.title: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar gifts director Om Raut Ferrari supercar worth ₹4.02 crore
322.article_body: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar, who is bankrolling the upcoming epic drama 'Adipurush', has gifted the film's director Om Raut a supercar. According to reports, Kumar has gifted Raut the Ferrari F8 Tributo, which is priced at ₹4.02 crore. Reports also suggest that the car is not straight out of the showroom, but instead, it was earlier registered in Kumar's name.

323.title: How do the T20 World Cup 2022 points tables read?
323.article_body: After Day 3 of T20 World Cup 2022, Netherlands are on top of the first round Group A table, with two wins. Meanwhile, Namibia are second and Sri Lanka are third with a win each. Scotland and Zimbabwe lead Group B table, followed by Ireland and West Indies. Top two teams from each group will advance to Super 12 stage.

324.title: Delhi man cheats people of ₹8 cr via fake franchise deals, arrested
324.article_body: Delhi Police's Economic Offences Wing has arrested a man for allegedly cheating people of ₹8 crore on the pretext of making them associates in a cargo business, officials said on Tuesday. The accused presented himself as the Executive Director of Bhagwati Airways Express Ltd. and signed franchise agreements with the complainants to make them business associates, police said.

325.title: Meta accepts UK's order to sell Giphy
325.article_body: Facebook parent Meta has agreed to sell the GIF creation platform, Giphy, two years after acquiring it in a reported $400 million deal. This comes after the UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) ordered Meta to sell Giphy on Tuesday after its view that the acquisition reduced innovation in the advertising market. "We are disappointed by the decision," Meta said.

326.title: 77,000 consumers face power outage due to heavy rains in Pune
326.article_body: At least 77,000 consumers faced power outages as supply to several housing societies in Pune was disrupted because of heavy rains on Monday evening, officials said. Technical staff and engineers of the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited worked throughout night and day to restore phase-wise supply. In some areas, the supply was restored by morning, a spokesperson said.

327.title: 2017 champion Kidambi Srikanth enters pre-quarterfinal of Denmark Open
327.article_body: Former champion Kidambi Srikanth entered the pre-quarterfinal of Denmark Open on Tuesday. The Indian shuttler defeated world number 14 Ng Ka Long Angus 17-21, 21-14, 21-12 in the first round. World number 11 Srikanth, who won the tournament in 2017, will now face Loh Kean Yew. The seventh seed beat Thailand's Sitthikom Thammasin 21-13, 22-20.

328.title: Japan to impose additional sanctions against North Korea
328.article_body: Japan will impose additional sanctions on North Korea by freezing the assets of groups involved in its missile development programme, a Japanese official said on Tuesday. He stated, "We cannot tolerate North Korea's repeated provocative actions...." This comes following a string of recent ballistic missile tests carried out by Pyongyang, including the one where a projectile was fired over Japan.

329.title: Kriti Sanon shares her first look from horror-comedy film 'Bhediya'
329.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon on Tuesday unveiled her first look from the upcoming horror-comedy film 'Bhediya'. "Meet Dr. Anika! Bhediya ki doctor!" she wrote while sharing the look on her Instagram handle. Praising her look, Ayushmann Khurrana wrote in the comments section, "Too cool!" Directed by Amar Kaushik, 'Bhediya' also stars Varun Dhawan.

330.title: Mumbai to have AC local train with fibre-reinforced polymer seats by Oct end
330.article_body: Western Railway's Mumbai Division is all set to have the newly inducted air-conditioned (AC) local train with modular fibre-reinforced polymer (FRP) seats by the end of October. It comprises four types of coaches with a combined carrying capacity of 1,118 passengers. It'll also have one coach equipped with flexi-solar panels that will power the fans and lights of the coach.

331.title: 5 people arrested for murder of priest, his son in Hyderabad's Uppal
331.article_body: Five people have been arrested for their alleged involvement in the murder of a 75-year-old priest named Narsimha and his 45-year-old son in Hyderabad's Uppal on Friday. Police said the main accused, Likki Vinay Yogendar Reddy, suspected Narsimha of performing black magic on him to avoid repaying him ₹6 lakh. Reddy had given Narsimha ₹6 lakh for performing a puja.

332.title: Rhea Chakraborty danced with inmates on her last day in jail: Sudha Bharadwaj
332.article_body: Activist Sudha Bharadwaj revealed that actress Rhea Chakraborty, who was arrested in a drugs case related to Sushant Singh Rajput's death, danced with inmates on her last day in jail. "When she left, she'd some money remaining in her account, so for all...barracks she asked for sweets to be given,"  added Sudha, who was lodged in the same jail.

333.title: Delhi Transport Dept denies vehicle to disabled girl, DCW sends notice
333.article_body: The Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) has issued a notice to the city government's Transport Department, over the alleged refusal by a dealer to sell a commercial vehicle to a specially-abled girl for personal use. The girl has requested approval for her to purchase the vehicle, which is spacious enough to accommodate her motorised wheelchair, as there's no alternative available.

334.title: Done as per law: Pralhad Joshi on release of Bilkis Bano rape convicts
334.article_body: Reacting to the release of 11 men convicted in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case, Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi said, "I do not find anything wrong in that because it is done as per the process of law." His remarks came after the Gujarat government told the Supreme Court that the convicts were released on grounds of "good behaviour".

335.title: Never nice to be on losing side: Erasmus after Namibia's loss vs Netherlands
335.article_body: Following Namibia's five-wicket loss against Netherlands in T20 World Cup 2022 Group A match, Namibia skipper Gerhard Erasmus said, "Never nice to be on...losing side when it's so close." He added, "We put a good show in the field. With...bat, it seemed difficult for both sides but they ran better than us." Netherlands chased the 122-run target in 19.3 overs.

336.title: There can be no safe havens for terrorists, drug cartels: PM Modi
336.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said there can be no safe havens for the corrupt, terrorists, drug cartels, poaching gangs and organised crime. He said, "When the threats are global, the response cannot be just local." He said a safe and secure world is "our shared responsibility", adding, "When the forces of good cooperate, the forces of crime can't operate."

337.title: Lulu Group to invest ₹3,000 crore to build India’s biggest mall at Ahmedabad
337.article_body: Lulu Group Director of Marketing and Communications V Nandakumar said it was planning to invest  ₹3,000 crore to set up India’s biggest shopping mall at Ahmedabad. He said the construction of the mall will begin early next year. The mall, which would have all modern facilities, would give direct and indirect employment to 6,000 and 12,000 people, respectively.

338.title: 3-yr-old washed away after falling into uncovered drain in Bengaluru
338.article_body: A three-year-old boy from Bengaluru's Varthur area has been reportedly washed away after he fell into an uncovered stormwater drain 100 metres from his home. The boy was playing with five other children when he fell inside. About 25 emergency services members are working to find the boy but heavy run-off from the recent rains is hampering rescue operations.

339.title: No merit in Umar Khalid's bail plea, it's dismissed: Delhi HC
339.article_body: The Delhi High Court denied bail to former JNU student Umar Khalid in the case related to an alleged conspiracy behind the Northeast Delhi riots in February 2020. "There is no merit in the bail appeal. Bail appeal is dismissed," said the bench. Khalid, who was arrested in September 2020, sought bail stating he had no role in the violence.

340.title: 'Powerful explosions' damaged Nord Stream gas pipelines: Denmark
340.article_body: Danish authorities on Tuesday confirmed that the Nord Stream 1 and 2 gas pipelines in the Baltic Sea have suffered "extensive damage", saying it was caused by "powerful explosions". Earlier this month, Sweden said its probe into the ruptures detected on the pipelines has "strengthened the suspicions of serious sabotage". Four leaks have been detected on the pipelines so far.

341.title: Anguished: PM after 7 people killed in Kedarnath helicopter crash
341.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said he is anguished by the helicopter crash in Uttarakhand. "In this tragic hour, my thoughts are with the bereaved families," PM Modi added. Seven people, including two pilots, were killed after a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims from Uttarakhand's Phata crashed on Tuesday. Meanwhile, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Dhami has ordered an investigation into the incident.

342.title: Railways, road corporation seek nod to fell 1,000 trees in B'luru
342.article_body: The forest cell of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) received two proposals from the South Western Railway (SWR) and Karnataka Road Development Corporation Limited (KRDCL) on October 17, seeking permission to fell nearly 1,000 trees. Citizens have been requested to file their objections regarding the projects for which the trees are proposed to be felled by October 27.

343.title: BEST to run extra buses in Mumbai, Suburbs & Navi Mumbai for Diwali
343.article_body: On the occasion of Diwali, BEST will run extra buses on prominent routes in Mumbai, Suburbs and Navi Mumbai between October 22 and October 26. The additional bus services will cover routes, including Dadar Plaza, Kalbadevi, Bandra, Mahatma Jyotiba Phule Market in Mumbai and APMC Market in Navi Mumbai. Moreover, 140 extra buses will run on Bhai Dooj (October 26).

344.title: Bride seeks groom from only specific 'Tier-1' colleges; matrimony ad goes viral
344.article_body: A matrimony advertisement went viral after a bride sought a groom from only specific colleges that she ranked as 'Tier-1', adding that he must be earning at least ₹30 LPA. Several Twitter users reacted to the ad, with one saying, "They're being honest...They have the right to do so." Another user tweeted, "I thought it was a job posting."

345.title: PM to virtually attend 'grih pravesh' of 4.5 lakh PMAY beneficiaries in MP
345.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will virtually participate in 'grih pravesh' of 4.50 lakh beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) on Dhanteras (October 22) in Madhya Pradesh, CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said. The main event will be held at BTI Ground, Satna. An official said 51,000 masons were trained for the construction of PMAY houses. 'Grih pravesh' is a house-warming ceremony.

346.title: Introduce 'Amar Chitra Katha' for entrepreneurship in school: Hurun India MD
346.article_body: Hurun India Founder and MD Anas Rahman Junaid said comic-like books around entrepreneurship and business must be introduced at school level in India to create children's interest in the subject at an early age. "It'll be interesting if someone can put together...something like an Amar Chitra Katha. That should do wonders," Junaid said. "Creating wealth is an art," he added.

347.title: Locals protest as stray dog mauls 7-month-old boy to death in Noida
347.article_body: Several people protested outside a housing society in Noida after a seven-month-old boy was mauled to death by a stray dog.
