The baby was reportedly admitted to ICU after his intestines were pulled out in the attack, however, he couldn't be saved. Meanwhile, a senior Noida Authority official said, "We're coordinating with...societies and dog shelters to check...menace of dog bites."

348.title: Man stabs estranged wife 13 times, hospitalised after suicide bid in B'luru
348.article_body: A 30-year-old man reportedly killed his 25-year-old estranged wife by stabbing her 13 times in Bengaluru. He later tried to take his own life and was hospitalised with injuries to his stomach and throat. The accused reportedly suspected his wife of having an affair. They married seven years ago and had been living separately for two years.

349.title: Disturbing elements illegally entered the Manchester consulate: China
349.article_body: After a pro-democracy Hong Kong protester was allegedly assaulted inside the Chinese consulate in Manchester, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin said that "disturbing elements" had illegally entered the consulate. Wang Wenbin declined to confirm or deny whether China's Consul General in Manchester was involved in the incident. British police launched an investigation into the case.

350.title: Man beats brother to death with frying pan in Ghaziabad; arrested
350.article_body: A man allegedly beat his brother to death with a frying pan on Sunday in Ghaziabad. Both the brothers, who have been identified as Bablu Kumar and Arjun Kumar, were reportedly drunk at the time of the incident. An argument reportedly broke out between them when Bablu was beating his wife over suspicion of having an extra-marital affair with Arjun.

351.title: It's now about winning 3rd game: Edwards on Netherlands' win vs Namibia
351.article_body: After Netherlands won their second consecutive Group A match in T20 World Cup 2022 against Namibia, Netherlands skipper Scott Edwards said that it's now about winning the third match to secure Super 12 qualification for his side. Netherlands defeated Namibia by five wickets. With four points from two matches, Netherlands are currently at the top of Group A standings.

352.title: Windows failed to protect users against malicious drivers: Report
352.article_body: Microsoft failed to protect millions of Windows users against malicious drivers as it didn't update the list of affected drivers in nearly three years, according to a report by Ars Technica. Exploiting the vulnerability, cybercriminals can take control of users' devices using a technique called 'BYOVD'. "Microsoft is...aware of BYOVD threat and has been working on defences," the report said.

353.title: Constable asks MP man to remove tinted glass from SUV windows, beaten
353.article_body: A man allegedly thrashed a traffic constable in Madhya Pradesh's Indore when the latter asked him to remove tinted glass from his car windows and pay a fine for violating rules on Monday. The 31-year-old SUV owner then hit his own head with a stone when he saw other police personnel approaching him, police said. The accused was arrested.

354.title: Byju’s standalone business posted loss in FY21 with 30% revenue drop
354.article_body: Edtech startup Byju's standalone business, comprising K-12 (kindergarten to class 12) offerings, posted a loss of ₹2,702.14 crore for FY21 against a profit of ₹7.39 crore in FY20 with revenues falling over 30% during the year, the company's recent filings with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs showed. Revenue from operations fell to ₹1,378.51 crore from ₹1,918.25 crore a year earlier.

355.title: Thane man seeking refund of ₹299 loses ₹49,000 to cyber fraud
355.article_body: A 54-year-old Kalyan resident seeking a refund of ₹299 for a failed mobile phone recharge was allegedly cheated of ₹49,950 in a cyber fraud. The victim received a call from a fraudster who offered to help him and sent a phishing link and induced him to share his bank account details and siphoned money from his account, police said.

356.title: UAE record lowest total of T20 World Cup 2022
356.article_body: UAE on Tuesday were dismissed for 73 runs in 17.1 overs by Sri Lanka in their T20 World Cup 2022 Round 1 match. It's the lowest total in T20 World Cup 2022. UAE's Aayan Afzal Khan, the youngest cricketer to feature in T20 World Cup aged 16, top-scored with 19(21). Meanwhile, eight of 11 UAE batters scored in single digits.

357.title: Tamil Nadu Assembly adopts resolution against imposition of Hindi
357.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government moved a resolution against Hindi imposition in the state Assembly. "This House expresses concern that the recommendations of the Parliamentary Committee...are against the two-language policy resolution moved and passed by Perarignar Anna...This House urges the Union government not to implement the recommendations made in the report," said the resolution.

358.title: Cong has again proved internal democracy: CEA on party's chief poll
358.article_body: Congress Central Election Authority (CEA) Chairman Madhusudan Mistry on Monday said the party has "once again proved what internal democracy is and other parties can take lessons from it". His statement came while addressing a press conference after the conclusion of voting for the Congress Presidential election. "By and large, 96% voting took place across states," Mistry stated.

359.title: Corruption-free administration needed for sustainable development: Kerala CM
359.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Tuesday said a corruption-free administrative system is necessary for sustainable development of a country and it is with this view the state government is functioning. "That's why Kerala has the honour of being the state with the least corruption in India," Vijayan said. In future, we would be able to eradicate it completely, Vijayan added.

360.title: India's Nutakki expelled from World Junior Chess C'ship for having earbuds in pocket
360.article_body: Indian Woman Grandmaster (WGM) Priyanka Nutakki has been expelled from World Junior Chess Championship being held in Italy for having earbuds in her jacket pocket. Saying that there is no indication of foul play on her part, FIDE stated that earbuds are "strictly forbidden" in playing hall. The point scored by Nutakki in sixth round was awarded to her opponent.

361.title: UAE's Junaid Siddique smashes biggest six of T20 World Cup 2022
361.article_body: UAE's number 10 batter Junaid Siddique smashed a 109-metre maximum on the bowling of Sri Lanka fast bowler Dushmantha Chameera during their T20 World Cup 2022 Round 1 match on Tuesday. It is the biggest six of T20 World Cup 2022. Notably, it was the only six of UAE's innings against Sri Lanka.

362.title: Harrison Ford joins MCU, to play 'Thunderbolt' Ross in Captain America 4
362.article_body: Veteran American actor Harrison Ford has joined the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) and will be seen in 'Captain America: New World Order', the fourth instalment in the 'Captain America' franchise. Harrison has replaced William Hurt to portray Thaddeus 'Thunderbolt' Ross. William passed away in March this year. The film is expected to release in 2024.

363.title: Indonesia to demolish football stadium where stampede killed 133
363.article_body: Indonesian President Joko Widodo has said that the football stadium where a stampede killed 133 people will be torn down and rebuilt according to FIFA standards. The new stadium will have "proper facilities that can ensure the safety of...players and supporters", he added. The stampede on October 1 happened after police tear-gassed fans who invaded the pitch after a defeat.

364.title: Amit Shah expresses grief over loss of lives in Kedarnath helicopter crash
364.article_body: After a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims crashed in Uttarakhand, Union Home Minister Amit Shah expressed grief over the incident. "The incident of the crash…is very saddening," Shah tweeted. "I express my condolences to the families of all those who lost their lives in this accident. May God give them the strength to bear this grief," Shah added.

365.title: Man files complaint about bad road, meets with accident on same road in B'luru
365.article_body: On October 6, a 66-year-old man moved a complaint to BBMP, stating the road from BEL Circle to Peenya Metro Station was in a bad condition. On Wednesday, he met with an accident on the same road while trying to avoid a pothole. Following the accident, the BBMP chief said redevelopment work of the stretch would be taken up soon.

366.title: 23 children killed in mass protests in Iran: UN rights office
366.article_body: At least 23 children have been killed in the protests in Iran, a UN human rights office spokesperson said. Children have been killed due to live ammunition, metal pellets at close range and fatal beatings. An unspecified number of children had been arrested during school raids, the rights office added. Protests were triggered after the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini.

367.title: Boman didn't have dates, I convinced him to do 'Uunchai': Anupam
367.article_body: Anupam Kher revealed that he had to convince Boman Irani to do 'Uunchai'. "When I asked Sooraj (Barjatya, director) about the cast, he said there's a nice role for Boman, but he doesn't have dates and has some personal commitments...So I called him later and convinced him to do the film," he said. The film will release on November 11.

368.title: Be responsible and choose appropriate words: Delhi court to Tejashwi
368.article_body: A Delhi court suggested Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav to be responsible and choose appropriate words while speaking in public. "You have to understand the implications of your words. This should not happen again," said the court. The court also refused to cancel the bail granted to him in the alleged Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) scam case.

369.title: Delhi to get 100 electric vehicle charging stations in 2 months: CM
369.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said the city would get 100 electric vehicle charging stations in the next two months. Kejriwal inaugurated 11 charging stations on Tuesday and said the facilities would also include battery swapping points. These 11 stations have 73 charging points, he added. The Delhi Electric Vehicles policy was introduced in 2020.

370.title: Mumbai Police return lost bag to owner with ₹2 lakh cash in 2 hours
370.article_body: Mumbai Police on Sunday traced and returned a bag with ₹2 lakh cash within two hours after the owner forgot the bag in an auto-rickshaw. According to police, the complainant and his brother boarded an auto from outside Borivali East railway station to purchase a second-hand taxi. "In a hurry...they forgot the bag with cash in the auto," police added.

371.title: 2 Naxalites surrender before security forces in Chhattisgarh's Sukma
371.article_body: Two Naxalites surrendered before the security forces in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district, police said on Tuesday. The surrendered Naxalites, identified as Ganga and Deva, were residents of Gadiras area and were a part of the Dandakaranya Adivasi Kisan Majdoor Sangthan (DAKMS), an official said. Ganga was carrying a reward of ₹1 lakh on his head, the official added.

372.title: Indian Railways to run 211 special trains amid festive season
372.article_body: The Indian Railways has announced 211 special trains across country amid festive season, the Railways announced on Tuesday. The trains will cover a total of 2,561 trips till Chhath Puja this year, the railways added. The trains will connect major destinations throughout the country such as Darbhanga, Azamgarh, Saharsa, Bhagalpur, Muzaffarpur, Firozpur, Patna, Katihar, and Amritsar, among others.

373.title: Pak official doesn't reply when asked 'will you handover Dawood to India?'; video out
373.article_body: Pakistan's chief of the Federal Investigation Agency (FIA) Mohsin Butt was on Tuesday asked by a reporter, "Will this process of extradition with India move forward? Will you handover Dawood Ibrahim to India?" A video of Butt's reaction showed him looking away from the reporter and refusing to answer his question. The video was taken during Interpol conference in Delhi.

374.title: Annexed Ukrainian regions protected by nuclear weapons: Russia
374.article_body: Russia on Tuesday said that the four Ukrainian regions annexed last month are under the protection of its nuclear arsenal. "All these territories [Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia] are inalienable parts of Russia," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned that Russia will use nuclear weapons if its "territorial integrity" is threatened.

375.title: Tech Mahindra signs MoU with Guj; to hire 3,000 employees in 5 yrs
375.article_body: Tech Mahindra has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Gujarat government under the latter's Employment Generation Incentive and the 'Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Sahay Yojana'. The IT giant plans to hire over 3,000 professionals in Gujarat over the next five years. Tech Mahindra's MoU is one among the 15 MoUs signed by Gujarat government with domestic and global IT companies.

376.title: No comparison with Lord Ram: Patole on Minister’s remark on Rahul
376.article_body: Responding to Rajasthan Minister Parsadi Lal Meena's comment, which likened Rahul Gandhi to Lord Ram, Congress' Nana Patole said that it's a coincidence that Rahul Gandhi and Lord Ram have an 'R' in their name. Rahul is covering even more distance than Lord Ram by walking from Kanniyakumari to Kashmir, Meena had earlier said.

377.title: Ambuja Cement raises ₹5,000 crore through Adani's family firm
377.article_body: Ambuja Cement on Tuesday said it has issued 47.74 crore warrants at a price band of ₹418.87 to Adani family firm Harmonia Trade and Investment and raised ₹5,000 crore. The warrants, issued on preferential basis to Harmonia, have a face value of ₹2. Harmonia Trade and Investment has until now paid ₹104.72/warrant, which is around 25% of the issue price.

378.title: AAP to build schools at every 4 km in 8 Guj cities if voted to power: Sisodia
378.article_body: If AAP is voted to power in Gujarat, it will build a government school at every four kilometres in eight cities within a year, Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said on Tuesday. "The people of Gujarat are determined to get schools made for their children and will elect a party that builds schools," Sisodia added.

379.title: 12 She mobile electric toilets rolled out in 6 GHMC zones
379.article_body: As part of the central government's Safe City initiative, 12 She mobile electric toilets have been rolled out for women in six Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) zones. The restrooms are available in Secunderabad, LB Nagar, Khairatabad, Charminar, Serilingampally and Kukatpally. In Hyderabad Commissionerate, facilities will be stationed at places like Dharna Chowk and Pragathi Bhavan.

380.title: Mini-bus rams into autorickshaw on way to school in Thane, 3 hurt
380.article_body: Three children travelling in an autorickshaw to school sustained injuries when a mini-bus crashed into their vehicle and dragged it for some distance in Thane. The injured children, class 2 students, were taken to a hospital for treatment. The autorickshaw driver said he jammed the brakes of the autorickshaw and ensured that the children didn't sustain any major injury.

381.title: Russia denies using Iranian drones in attack on Ukraine
381.article_body: The Kremlin on Tuesday denied that its forces had used Iranian drones to attack Ukraine, saying that Russian equipment with Russian nomenclature was used. Ukraine accused Russia of using Iranian Shahed-136 "kamikaze" drones, which explode on impact, to carry out attacks in Kyiv. Iran has denied supplying drones to Russia, however, the US State Department accused Iran of lying.

382.title: 'Scam 1992' fame Pratik Gandhi buys Mercedes car worth ₹1.16 crore, pics surface
382.article_body: Actor Pratik Gandhi, who played the role of Harshad Mehta in 'Scam 1992', bought a Mercedes-Benz GLS 450 which is worth around ₹1.16 crore. As per reports, the actor purchased the car on the occasion of Dussehra. Pratik was recently seen in 'Kahani Rubberband Ki', which was released on October 14.

383.title: Singer Chinmayi shares pic of her baby bump, rubbishes surrogacy rumours
383.article_body: Singer Chinmayi Sripaada, who welcomed twins in June, took to Instagram to share a picture of her baby bump. "The only selfie I took throughout pregnancy. The only. Here at almost 32 weeks," she captioned the picture. In a video, the 38-year-old rubbished rumours about her babies born via surrogacy and revealed that she had her twins after a miscarriage.

384.title: Suspect uploads morphed video of Gurugram girl on Insta reels; case filed
384.article_body: An unidentified person was booked for allegedly uploading a morphed video of a Gurugram-based girl on social media. The suspect made an Instagram reel in which a minor's face was added to a pornographic video and then the video link was sent to her father, the police said. The act seemed to be an attempt to defame her, police added.

385.title: Tata Communications' Q2 net profit rises by 25% to ₹532 crore
385.article_body: Tata Communications on Tuesday reported a 25.1% surge in its consolidated net profit for the September quarter at ₹532 crore from ₹425 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Its revenue from operations was ₹4,431 crore, a 6.2% increase as against ₹4,174 crore in the same quarter last year. Data business revenues were at ₹3,493 crore, a 4.6% increase quarter-on-quarter.

386.title: Ather Energy raises ₹400.6 crore in Caladium Investment-led round
386.article_body: Electric vehicle maker Ather Energy has secured ₹400.6 crore in a funding round led by Caladium Investment which invested ₹400 crore, according to Registrar of Companies' filings. The funding round also saw participation from Herald Square Ventures which pumped in ₹64 lakh. In May 2022, the startup had raised around ₹991 crore in a Series E funding round.

387.title: UP principal locks girl in room, chops her hair for coming to school with 1 braid
387.article_body: A school principal in Uttar Pradesh's Farrukhabad was booked for allegedly locking up a girl student in a room and chopping off her hair against her will. The girl alleged that the principal had made it a rule that all the girls have to come to school with two braids. She was 'punished' as she had made only one braid.

388.title: Case filed over morphed video of minor in Gurugram
388.article_body: Gurugram Police booked an unidentified suspect for allegedly uploading a morphed video of a girl on social media. The accused made an Instagram reel in which the minor's face was added to a pornographic video and then the video was sent to her father, police said. The FIR was lodged under section 67A of the Information Technology Act.

389.title: Akshay set himself on fire in 'Waqt...', I asked 'What're you doing?': Big B
389.article_body: Talking about Akshay Kumar during an episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', actor Amitabh Bachchan said, "Akshay jumps from one building to another. In 'Waqt: The Race Against Time', he set himself on fire." "I keep asking him, 'What're you doing?', and he responds that [the stunt] will be done," added Amitabh. "Akshay does [the stunts] well also," he stated.

390.title: He's a nice man: Azharuddin on Binny's appointment as new BCCI President
390.article_body: Commenting on Roger Binny's appointment as the new BCCI President, replacing Sourav Ganguly, ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin said, "He (Binny) is a nice man." He added, "I have played a lot of cricket with him and we have fond memories." Former India cricketer Binny was appointed as the 36th President of BCCI on Tuesday.

391.title: Cognizant rolls out salary hikes for employees after Wipro & TCS
391.article_body: IT company Cognizant has begun rolling out annual salary hikes for its employees, reportedly ranged between 7% to 10%. This comes after Wipro, TCS and Infosys rolled out hikes recently. Last week, Cognizant told its employees that "formal eLetters" with new compensation would be out through the week and the hike would take effect for levels up to associate director.

392.title: A transforming, different experience for me: Ishaan on 'Pippa'
392.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter said his upcoming film 'Pippa' has certainly been "a transforming, different experience" for him. "It is in that kind of zone that is not being explored by young actors," Ishaan added. In 'Pippa', Ishaan will be seen playing Brigadier Balram Singh Mehta, who fought on the eastern front during the Indo-Pakistan War of 1971.

393.title: Liverpool are still a great team: Ex-forward Sadio Mane
393.article_body: Ex-Liverpool forward Sadio Mane has said Liverpool played with a great mindset against Manchester City to claim their third Premier League win of the season on Sunday. "It shows that they still are a great team. Liverpool will always be Liverpool," he added. Liverpool beat defending champions Manchester City 1-0 at Anfield. Mane joined Bayern Munich in June this year.

394.title: Challenge him to say he's ready for narco test: Mishra on Sisodia's CBI claim
394.article_body: After Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said that he was asked to leave the Aam Aadmi Party inside the CBI office, BJP leader Kapil Mishra said that he challenges him to apologise by 5 pm today. "I challenge him to either apologise or face media...and say he's ready for a lie detector test and narco test," he added.

395.title: On suspicion of theft, man threatens to drop boy in well in MP
395.article_body: A case has been filed after a man held a boy in a well by the hand and threatened to drop him on the suspicion that he stole a phone in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur, police said on Tuesday. A teenager, who recorded a video of the incident, informed the boy's parents. Video purportedly shows the boy dangling in the well.

396.title: President Murmu condoles loss of lives in Kedarnath helicopter crash
396.article_body: After a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims crashed in Uttarakhand, President Droupadi Murmu on Tuesday condoled the loss of lives in the incident. Seven people, including a pilot, have been killed in the incident, officials said. "My deepest condolences to the families who lost their loved ones," President Murmu tweeted. PM Narendra Modi also expressed grief over the incident.

397.title: Man sets ablaze 5 family members including 2 stepchildren in Punjab
397.article_body: As many as five members of a family, including two children, were allegedly burnt to death by their 30-year-old stepfather at a village in Punjab's Jalandhar, police said. The accused, a daily wager, mixed petrol and diesel, and sprayed on the victims before setting them ablaze, police added. Among the deceased were his wife and her parents.

398.title: 2 tourists killed, 3 injured in hot air balloon mishap in Turkey
398.article_body: A hot air balloon carrying 28 passengers and two crew members made a hard landing in Turkey's Cappadocia on Tuesday, killing two Spanish tourists and injuring three others from Spain, the local governor's office said. An unexpected increase in wind speed has been identified as the cause of the accident, according to initial assessments, the governor said in a statement.

399.title: Electronics Mart India shares rise 10% after Nippon India MF buys stake
399.article_body: Electronics Mart India's stock locked in the 10% upper circuit at ₹92.95/share on NSE on Tuesday, a day after Nippon India Mutual Fund bought an additional 0.6% of its equity stake at an average price of ₹89.42 apiece. In the previous session, which was the first trading day for the stock after IPO, its shares closed at a 43% gain.

400.title: My dream is to cover distance between Delhi & Mumbai's Nariman Point in 12 hrs: Gadkari
400.article_body: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday said it was his "dream" to connect Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link directly with Mumbai-Delhi Express Highway. He added, "My dream is also to connect Nariman Point (in Mumbai) with Delhi and cover the entire distance in 12 hours." The first phase of the Delhi-Mumbai expressway will be completed this year, he said.
